◆ coprime()

int coprime ( const uint16_t *  a,
const uint16_t *  b 
)

Definition at line 924 of file tests.c.

924 {
925 uint16_t x[16], y[16], t[16];
926 int i;
927 int iszero;
928 memcpy(x, a, 32);
929 memcpy(y, b, 32);
930
931 /* simple gcd loop: while x!=0, (x,y)=(y%x,x) */
932 while (1) {
933 iszero = 1;
934 for (i = 0; i < 16; ++i) {
935 if (x[i] != 0) {
936 iszero = 0;
937 break;
938 }
939 }
940 if (iszero) break;
941 mulmod256(t, y, NULL, x);
942 memcpy(y, x, 32);
943 memcpy(x, t, 32);
944 }
945
946 /* return whether y=1 */
947 if (y[0] != 1) return 0;
948 for (i = 1; i < 16; ++i) {
949 if (y[i] != 0) return 0;
950 }
951 return 1;
952}
mulmod256

Definition at line 6097 of file tests.c.

6097 {
6098 int pos;
6099 int action = secp256k1_testrand_bits(3);
6100 if (action < 1 && *len > 3) {
6101 /* Delete a byte. */
6102 pos = secp256k1_testrand_int(*len);
6103 memmove(sig + pos, sig + pos + 1, *len - pos - 1);
6104 (*len)--;
6105 return;
6106 } else if (action < 2 && *len < 2048) {
6107 /* Insert a byte. */
6108 pos = secp256k1_testrand_int(1 + *len);
6109 memmove(sig + pos + 1, sig + pos, *len - pos);
6110 sig[pos] = secp256k1_testrand_bits(8);
6111 (*len)++;
6112 return;
6113 } else if (action < 4) {
6114 /* Modify a byte. */
6115 sig[secp256k1_testrand_int(*len)] += 1 + secp256k1_testrand_int(255);
6116 return;
6117 } else { /* action < 8 */
6118 /* Modify a bit. */
6119 sig[secp256k1_testrand_int(*len)] ^= 1 << secp256k1_testrand_bits(3);
6120 return;
6121 }
6122}

int  xvalid,

Definition at line 4970 of file tests.c.

4970 {
4971 unsigned char pubkeyc[65];
4972 secp256k1_pubkey pubkey;
4973 secp256k1_ge ge;
4974 size_t pubkeyclen;
4975 int32_t ecount;
4976 ecount = 0;
4977 secp256k1_context_set_illegal_callback(ctx, counting_illegal_callback_fn, &ecount);
4978 for (pubkeyclen = 3; pubkeyclen <= 65; pubkeyclen++) {
4979 /* Smaller sizes are tested exhaustively elsewhere. */
4980 int32_t i;
4981 memcpy(&pubkeyc[1], input, 64);
4982 VG_UNDEF(&pubkeyc[pubkeyclen], 65 - pubkeyclen);
4983 for (i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
4984 /* Try all type bytes. */
4985 int xpass;
4986 int ypass;
4987 int ysign;
4988 pubkeyc[0] = i;
4989 /* What sign does this point have? */
4990 ysign = (input[63] & 1) + 2;
4991 /* For the current type (i) do we expect parsing to work? Handled all of compressed/uncompressed/hybrid. */
4992 xpass = xvalid && (pubkeyclen == 33) && ((i & 254) == 2);
4993 /* Do we expect a parse and re-serialize as uncompressed to give a matching y? */
4994 ypass = xvalid && yvalid && ((i & 4) == ((pubkeyclen == 65) << 2)) &&
4995 ((i == 4) || ((i & 251) == ysign)) && ((pubkeyclen == 33) || (pubkeyclen == 65));
4996 if (xpass || ypass) {
4997 /* These cases must parse. */
4998 unsigned char pubkeyo[65];
4999 size_t outl;
5000 memset(&pubkey, 0, sizeof(pubkey));
5001 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5002 ecount = 0;
5003 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_parse(ctx, &pubkey, pubkeyc, pubkeyclen) == 1);
5004 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5005 outl = 65;
5006 VG_UNDEF(pubkeyo, 65);
5007 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_serialize(ctx, pubkeyo, &outl, &pubkey, SECP256K1_EC_COMPRESSED) == 1);
5008 VG_CHECK(pubkeyo, outl);
5009 CHECK(outl == 33);
5010 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkeyo[1], &pubkeyc[1], 32) == 0);
5011 CHECK((pubkeyclen != 33) || (pubkeyo[0] == pubkeyc[0]));
5012 if (ypass) {
5013 /* This test isn't always done because we decode with alternative signs, so the y won't match. */
5014 CHECK(pubkeyo[0] == ysign);
5015 CHECK(secp256k1_pubkey_load(ctx, &ge, &pubkey) == 1);
5016 memset(&pubkey, 0, sizeof(pubkey));
5017 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5018 secp256k1_pubkey_save(&pubkey, &ge);
5019 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5020 outl = 65;
5021 VG_UNDEF(pubkeyo, 65);
5022 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_serialize(ctx, pubkeyo, &outl, &pubkey, SECP256K1_EC_UNCOMPRESSED) == 1);
5023 VG_CHECK(pubkeyo, outl);
5024 CHECK(outl == 65);
5025 CHECK(pubkeyo[0] == 4);
5026 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkeyo[1], input, 64) == 0);
5027 }
5028 CHECK(ecount == 0);
5029 } else {
5030 /* These cases must fail to parse. */
5031 memset(&pubkey, 0xfe, sizeof(pubkey));
5032 ecount = 0;
5033 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5034 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_parse(ctx, &pubkey, pubkeyc, pubkeyclen) == 0);
5035 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5036 CHECK(ecount == 0);
5037 CHECK(secp256k1_pubkey_load(ctx, &ge, &pubkey) == 0);
5038 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5039 }
5040 }
5041 }
5042 secp256k1_context_set_illegal_callback(ctx, NULL, NULL);
5043}

3027 {
3028 secp256k1_fe z2s;
3029 secp256k1_fe u1, u2, s1, s2;
3030 CHECK(a->infinity == b->infinity);
3031 if (a->infinity) {
3032 return;
3033 }
3034 /* Check a.x * b.z^2 == b.x && a.y * b.z^3 == b.y, to avoid inverses. */
3035 secp256k1_fe_sqr(&z2s, &b->z);
3036 secp256k1_fe_mul(&u1, &a->x, &z2s);
3037 u2 = b->x; secp256k1_fe_normalize_weak(&u2);
3038 secp256k1_fe_mul(&s1, &a->y, &z2s); secp256k1_fe_mul(&s1, &s1, &b->z);
3039 s2 = b->y; secp256k1_fe_normalize_weak(&s2);
3040 CHECK(secp256k1_fe_equal_var(&u1, &u2));
3041 CHECK(secp256k1_fe_equal_var(&s1, &s2));
3042}

6861 {
6862 /* Disable buffering for stdout to improve reliability of getting

6864 * setbuf must be used before any other operation on the stream. */
6865 setbuf(stdout, NULL);
6866 /* Also disable buffering for stderr because it's not guaranteed that it's
6867 * unbuffered on all systems. */
6868 setbuf(stderr, NULL);
6869
6870 /* find iteration count */
6871 if (argc > 1) {
6872 count = strtol(argv[1], NULL, 0);
6873 } else {
6874 const char* env = getenv("SECP256K1_TEST_ITERS");
6875 if (env && strlen(env) > 0) {
6876 count = strtol(env, NULL, 0);
6877 }
6878 }
6879 if (count <= 0) {
6880 fputs("An iteration count of 0 or less is not allowed.\n", stderr);
6881 return EXIT_FAILURE;
6882 }
6883 printf("test count = %i\n", count);
6884
6885 /* find random seed */
6886 secp256k1_testrand_init(argc > 2 ? argv[2] : NULL);
6887
6888 /* initialize */
6889 run_context_tests(0);
6890 run_context_tests(1);
6891 run_scratch_tests();
6892 ctx = secp256k1_context_create(SECP256K1_CONTEXT_SIGN | SECP256K1_CONTEXT_VERIFY);
6893 if (secp256k1_testrand_bits(1)) {
6894 unsigned char rand32[32];
6895 secp256k1_testrand256(rand32);
6896 CHECK(secp256k1_context_randomize(ctx, secp256k1_testrand_bits(1) ? rand32 : NULL));
6897 }
6898
6899 run_rand_bits();
6900 run_rand_int();
6901
6902 run_ctz_tests();
6903 run_modinv_tests();
6904 run_inverse_tests();
6905
6906 run_sha256_tests();
6907 run_hmac_sha256_tests();
6908 run_rfc6979_hmac_sha256_tests();
6909 run_tagged_sha256_tests();
6910
6911 /* scalar tests */
6912 run_scalar_tests();
6913
6914 /* field tests */
6915 run_field_misc();
6916 run_field_convert();
6917 run_fe_mul();
6918 run_sqr();
6919 run_sqrt();
6920
6921 /* group tests */
6922 run_ge();
6923 run_gej();
6924 run_group_decompress();
6925
6926 /* ecmult tests */
6927 run_ecmult_pre_g();
6928 run_wnaf();
6929 run_point_times_order();
6930 run_ecmult_near_split_bound();
6931 run_ecmult_chain();
6932 run_ecmult_constants();
6933 run_ecmult_gen_blind();
6934 run_ecmult_const_tests();
6935 run_ecmult_multi_tests();
6936 run_ec_combine();
6937
6938 /* endomorphism tests */
6939 run_endomorphism_tests();
6940
6941 /* EC point parser test */
6942 run_ec_pubkey_parse_test();
6943
6944 /* EC key edge cases */
6945 run_eckey_edge_case_test();
6946
6947 /* EC key arithmetic test */
6948 run_eckey_negate_test();
6949
6950#ifdef ENABLE_MODULE_ECDH
6951 /* ecdh tests */
6952 run_ecdh_tests();
6953#endif
6954
6955 /* ecdsa tests */
6956 run_pubkey_comparison();
6957 run_random_pubkeys();
6958 run_ecdsa_der_parse();
6959 run_ecdsa_sign_verify();
6960 run_ecdsa_end_to_end();
6961 run_ecdsa_edge_cases();
6962
6963#ifdef ENABLE_MODULE_RECOVERY
6964 /* ECDSA pubkey recovery tests */
6965 run_recovery_tests();
6966#endif
6967
6968#ifdef ENABLE_MODULE_EXTRAKEYS
6969 run_extrakeys_tests();
6970#endif
6971
6972#ifdef ENABLE_MODULE_SCHNORRSIG
6973 run_schnorrsig_tests();
6974#endif
6975
6976 /* util tests */
6977 run_secp256k1_memczero_test();
6978
6979 run_cmov_tests();
6980
6981 secp256k1_testrand_finish();
6982
6983 /* shutdown */
6984 secp256k1_context_destroy(ctx);
6985
6986 printf("no problems found\n");
6987 return 0;
6988}

◆ modinv2p64()

uint64_t modinv2p64 ( uint64_t  x)

Definition at line 682 of file tests.c.

682 {
683 /* If w = 1/x mod 2^(2^L), then w*(2 - w*x) = 1/x mod 2^(2^(L+1)). See
684 * Hacker's Delight second edition, Henry S. Warren, Jr., pages 245-247 for
685 * why. Start with L=0, for which it is true for every odd x that
686 * 1/x=1 mod 2. Iterating 6 times gives us 1/x mod 2^64. */
687 int l;
688 uint64_t w = 1;
689 CHECK(x & 1);
690 for (l = 0; l < 6; ++l) w *= (2 - w*x);
691 return w;
692}
uint64_t
unsigned __int64 uint64_t
Definition: winunistd.h:59

References CHECK.

Referenced by test_modinv32_uint16().

◆ mulmod256()

void mulmod256 ( uint16_t *  out,
const uint16_t *  a,
const uint16_t *  b,
const uint16_t *  m 
)

Definition at line 698 of file tests.c.

698 {
699 uint16_t mul[32];
700 uint64_t c = 0;
701 int i, j;
702 int m_bitlen = 0;
703 int mul_bitlen = 0;
704
705 if (b != NULL) {
706 /* Compute the product of a and b, and put it in mul. */
707 for (i = 0; i < 32; ++i) {
708 for (j = i <= 15 ? 0 : i - 15; j <= i && j <= 15; j++) {
709 c += (uint64_t)a[j] * b[i - j];
710 }
711 mul[i] = c & 0xFFFF;
712 c >>= 16;
713 }
714 CHECK(c == 0);
715
716 /* compute the highest set bit in mul */
717 for (i = 511; i >= 0; --i) {
718 if ((mul[i >> 4] >> (i & 15)) & 1) {
719 mul_bitlen = i;
720 break;
721 }
722 }
723 } else {
724 /* if b==NULL, set mul=a. */
725 memcpy(mul, a, 32);
726 memset(mul + 16, 0, 32);
727 /* compute the highest set bit in mul */
728 for (i = 255; i >= 0; --i) {
729 if ((mul[i >> 4] >> (i & 15)) & 1) {
730 mul_bitlen = i;
731 break;
732 }
733 }
734 }
735
736 /* Compute the highest set bit in m. */
737 for (i = 255; i >= 0; --i) {
738 if ((m[i >> 4] >> (i & 15)) & 1) {
739 m_bitlen = i;
740 break;
741 }
742 }
743
744 /* Try do mul -= m<<i, for i going down to 0, whenever the result is not negative */
745 for (i = mul_bitlen - m_bitlen; i >= 0; --i) {
746 uint16_t mul2[32];
747 int64_t cs;
748
749 /* Compute mul2 = mul - m<<i. */
750 cs = 0; /* accumulator */
751 for (j = 0; j < 32; ++j) { /* j loops over the output limbs in mul2. */
752 /* Compute sub: the 16 bits in m that will be subtracted from mul2[j]. */
753 uint16_t sub = 0;
754 int p;
755 for (p = 0; p < 16; ++p) { /* p loops over the bit positions in mul2[j]. */
756 int bitpos = j * 16 - i + p; /* bitpos is the correspond bit position in m. */
757 if (bitpos >= 0 && bitpos < 256) {
758 sub |= ((m[bitpos >> 4] >> (bitpos & 15)) & 1) << p;
759 }
760 }
761 /* Add mul[j]-sub to accumulator, and shift bottom 16 bits out to mul2[j]. */
762 cs += mul[j];
763 cs -= sub;
764 mul2[j] = (cs & 0xFFFF);
765 cs >>= 16;
766 }
767 /* If remainder of subtraction is 0, set mul = mul2. */
768 if (cs == 0) {
769 memcpy(mul, mul2, sizeof(mul));
770 }
771 }
772 /* Sanity check: test that all limbs higher than m's highest are zero */
773 for (i = (m_bitlen >> 4) + 1; i < 32; ++i) {
774 CHECK(mul[i] == 0);
775 }
776 memcpy(out, mul, 32);
777}
int64_t
__int64 int64_t

803 x->v[pos] -= 0x40000000;

805 } else if (x->v[pos] < 0 && x->v[pos + 1] >= 0x3fffffff) {

Definition at line 5722 of file tests.c.

5722 {
5723 /* Dummy nonce generator that produces unacceptable nonces for the first several counter values. */
5724 if (counter < 3) {
5725 memset(nonce32, counter==0 ? 0 : 255, 32);
5726 if (counter == 2) {
5727 nonce32[31]--;
5728 }
5729 return 1;
5730 }
5731 if (counter < 5) {
5732 static const unsigned char order[] = {
5733 0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,
5734 0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFE,
5735 0xBA,0xAE,0xDC,0xE6,0xAF,0x48,0xA0,0x3B,
5736 0xBF,0xD2,0x5E,0x8C,0xD0,0x36,0x41,0x41
5737 };
5738 memcpy(nonce32, order, 32);
5739 if (counter == 4) {
5740 nonce32[31]++;
5741 }
5742 return 1;
5743 }
5744 /* Retry rate of 6979 is negligible esp. as we only call this in deterministic tests. */
5745 /* If someone does fine a case where it retries for secp256k1, we'd like to know. */
5746 if (counter > 5) {
5747 return 0;
5748 }
5749 return nonce_function_rfc6979(nonce32, msg32, key32, algo16, data, counter - 5);
5750}

◆ random_ber_signature()

static void random_ber_signature ( unsigned char *  sig,
size_t *  len,
int *  certainly_der,
int *  certainly_not_der 
)
static

Definition at line 6124 of file tests.c.

6124 {
6125 int der;
6126 int nlow[2], nlen[2], nlenlen[2], nhbit[2], nhbyte[2], nzlen[2];
6127 size_t tlen, elen, glen;
6128 int indet;
6129 int n;
6130
6131 *len = 0;
6132 der = secp256k1_testrand_bits(2) == 0;
6133 *certainly_der = der;
6134 *certainly_not_der = 0;
6135 indet = der ? 0 : secp256k1_testrand_int(10) == 0;
6136
6137 for (n = 0; n < 2; n++) {
6138 /* We generate two classes of numbers: nlow==1 "low" ones (up to 32 bytes), nlow==0 "high" ones (32 bytes with 129 top bits set, or larger than 32 bytes) */
6139 nlow[n] = der ? 1 : (secp256k1_testrand_bits(3) != 0);
6140 /* The length of the number in bytes (the first byte of which will always be nonzero) */
6141 nlen[n] = nlow[n] ? secp256k1_testrand_int(33) : 32 + secp256k1_testrand_int(200) * secp256k1_testrand_bits(3) / 8;
6142 CHECK(nlen[n] <= 232);
6143 /* The top bit of the number. */
6144 nhbit[n] = (nlow[n] == 0 && nlen[n] == 32) ? 1 : (nlen[n] == 0 ? 0 : secp256k1_testrand_bits(1));
6145 /* The top byte of the number (after the potential hardcoded 16 0xFF characters for "high" 32 bytes numbers) */
6146 nhbyte[n] = nlen[n] == 0 ? 0 : (nhbit[n] ? 128 + secp256k1_testrand_bits(7) : 1 + secp256k1_testrand_int(127));
6147 /* The number of zero bytes in front of the number (which is 0 or 1 in case of DER, otherwise we extend up to 300 bytes) */
6148 nzlen[n] = der ? ((nlen[n] == 0 || nhbit[n]) ? 1 : 0) : (nlow[n] ? secp256k1_testrand_int(3) : secp256k1_testrand_int(300 - nlen[n]) * secp256k1_testrand_bits(3) / 8);
6149 if (nzlen[n] > ((nlen[n] == 0 || nhbit[n]) ? 1 : 0)) {
6150 *certainly_not_der = 1;
6151 }
6152 CHECK(nlen[n] + nzlen[n] <= 300);
6153 /* The length of the length descriptor for the number. 0 means short encoding, anything else is long encoding. */
6154 nlenlen[n] = nlen[n] + nzlen[n] < 128 ? 0 : (nlen[n] + nzlen[n] < 256 ? 1 : 2);
6155 if (!der) {
6156 /* nlenlen[n] max 127 bytes */
6157 int add = secp256k1_testrand_int(127 - nlenlen[n]) * secp256k1_testrand_bits(4) * secp256k1_testrand_bits(4) / 256;
6158 nlenlen[n] += add;
6159 if (add != 0) {
6160 *certainly_not_der = 1;
6161 }
6162 }
6163 CHECK(nlen[n] + nzlen[n] + nlenlen[n] <= 427);
6164 }
6165
6166 /* The total length of the data to go, so far */
6167 tlen = 2 + nlenlen[0] + nlen[0] + nzlen[0] + 2 + nlenlen[1] + nlen[1] + nzlen[1];
6168 CHECK(tlen <= 856);
6169
6170 /* The length of the garbage inside the tuple. */
6171 elen = (der || indet) ? 0 : secp256k1_testrand_int(980 - tlen) * secp256k1_testrand_bits(3) / 8;
6172 if (elen != 0) {
6173 *certainly_not_der = 1;
6174 }
6175 tlen += elen;
6176 CHECK(tlen <= 980);
6177
6178 /* The length of the garbage after the end of the tuple. */
6179 glen = der ? 0 : secp256k1_testrand_int(990 - tlen) * secp256k1_testrand_bits(3) / 8;
6180 if (glen != 0) {
6181 *certainly_not_der = 1;
6182 }
6183 CHECK(tlen + glen <= 990);
6184
6185 /* Write the tuple header. */
6186 sig[(*len)++] = 0x30;
6187 if (indet) {
6188 /* Indeterminate length */
6189 sig[(*len)++] = 0x80;
6190 *certainly_not_der = 1;
6191 } else {
6192 int tlenlen = tlen < 128 ? 0 : (tlen < 256 ? 1 : 2);
6193 if (!der) {
6194 int add = secp256k1_testrand_int(127 - tlenlen) * secp256k1_testrand_bits(4) * secp256k1_testrand_bits(4) / 256;
6195 tlenlen += add;
6196 if (add != 0) {
6197 *certainly_not_der = 1;
6198 }
6199 }
6200 if (tlenlen == 0) {
6201 /* Short length notation */
6202 sig[(*len)++] = tlen;
6203 } else {
6204 /* Long length notation */
6205 sig[(*len)++] = 128 + tlenlen;
6206 assign_big_endian(sig + *len, tlenlen, tlen);
6207 *len += tlenlen;
6208 }
6209 tlen += tlenlen;
6210 }
6211 tlen += 2;
6212 CHECK(tlen + glen <= 1119);
6213
6214 for (n = 0; n < 2; n++) {
6215 /* Write the integer header. */
6216 sig[(*len)++] = 0x02;
6217 if (nlenlen[n] == 0) {
6218 /* Short length notation */
6219 sig[(*len)++] = nlen[n] + nzlen[n];
6220 } else {
6221 /* Long length notation. */
6222 sig[(*len)++] = 128 + nlenlen[n];
6223 assign_big_endian(sig + *len, nlenlen[n], nlen[n] + nzlen[n]);
6224 *len += nlenlen[n];
6225 }
6226 /* Write zero padding */
6227 while (nzlen[n] > 0) {
6228 sig[(*len)++] = 0x00;
6229 nzlen[n]--;
6230 }
6231 if (nlen[n] == 32 && !nlow[n]) {
6232 /* Special extra 16 0xFF bytes in "high" 32-byte numbers */
6233 int i;
6234 for (i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
6235 sig[(*len)++] = 0xFF;
6236 }
6237 nlen[n] -= 16;
6238 }
6239 /* Write first byte of number */
6240 if (nlen[n] > 0) {
6241 sig[(*len)++] = nhbyte[n];
6242 nlen[n]--;
6243 }
6244 /* Generate remaining random bytes of number */
6245 secp256k1_testrand_bytes_test(sig + *len, nlen[n]);
6246 *len += nlen[n];
6247 nlen[n] = 0;
6248 }
6249
6250 /* Generate random garbage inside tuple. */
6251 secp256k1_testrand_bytes_test(sig + *len, elen);
6252 *len += elen;
6253
6254 /* Generate end-of-contents bytes. */
6255 if (indet) {
6256 sig[(*len)++] = 0;
6257 sig[(*len)++] = 0;
6258 tlen += 2;
6259 }
6260 CHECK(tlen + glen <= 1121);
6261
6262 /* Generate random garbage outside tuple. */
6263 secp256k1_testrand_bytes_test(sig + *len, glen);
6264 *len += glen;
6265 tlen += glen;
6266 CHECK(tlen <= 1121);
6267 CHECK(tlen == *len);
6268}
secp256k1_testrand_bytes_test
static void secp256k1_testrand_bytes_test(unsigned char *bytes, size_t len)
assign_big_endian
static void assign_big_endian(unsigned char *ptr, size_t ptrlen, uint32_t val)

208 /*** clone and destroy all of them to make sure cloning was complete ***/
209 {
210 secp256k1_context *ctx_tmp;

212 if (use_prealloc) {

230 /* clone into a preallocated context and then again into a new non-preallocated one. */
231 void *prealloc_tmp;
232

253 }
254
255 /* Verify that the error callback makes it across the clone. */
256 CHECK(sign->error_callback.fn != vrfy->error_callback.fn);
257 CHECK(sign->error_callback.fn == secp256k1_default_illegal_callback_fn);
258 /* And that it resets back to default. */
259 secp256k1_context_set_error_callback(sign, NULL, NULL);

261
262 /*** attempt to use them ***/

267
268 /* Verify context-type checking illegal-argument errors. */

270 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_create(sttc, &pubkey, ctmp) == 0);
271 CHECK(ecount == 1);
272 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
273 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_create(sign, &pubkey, ctmp) == 1);
274 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));

276 CHECK(ecount == 2);
277 VG_UNDEF(&sig, sizeof(sig));
278 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sign(sign, &sig, ctmp, ctmp, NULL, NULL) == 1);
279 VG_CHECK(&sig, sizeof(sig));
280 CHECK(ecount2 == 10);
281 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_verify(sign, &sig, ctmp, &pubkey) == 1);
282 CHECK(ecount2 == 10);
283 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_verify(sttc, &sig, ctmp, &pubkey) == 1);
284 CHECK(ecount == 2);
285 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_add(sign, &pubkey, ctmp) == 1);
286 CHECK(ecount2 == 10);
287 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_add(sttc, &pubkey, ctmp) == 1);
288 CHECK(ecount == 2);
289 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_mul(sign, &pubkey, ctmp) == 1);
290 CHECK(ecount2 == 10);
291 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_negate(sttc, &pubkey) == 1);
292 CHECK(ecount == 2);
293 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_negate(sign, &pubkey) == 1);
294 CHECK(ecount == 2);
295 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_negate(sign, NULL) == 0);
296 CHECK(ecount2 == 11);
297 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_negate(sttc, &zero_pubkey) == 0);
298 CHECK(ecount == 3);
299 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_mul(sttc, &pubkey, ctmp) == 1);
300 CHECK(ecount == 3);
301 CHECK(secp256k1_context_randomize(sttc, ctmp) == 1);
302 CHECK(ecount == 3);
303 CHECK(secp256k1_context_randomize(sttc, NULL) == 1);
304 CHECK(ecount == 3);
305 CHECK(secp256k1_context_randomize(sign, ctmp) == 1);
306 CHECK(ecount2 == 11);
307 CHECK(secp256k1_context_randomize(sign, NULL) == 1);
308 CHECK(ecount2 == 11);
309 secp256k1_context_set_illegal_callback(sttc, NULL, NULL);
310 secp256k1_context_set_illegal_callback(sign, NULL, NULL);
311
312 /* obtain a working nonce */
313 do {
314 random_scalar_order_test(&nonce);
315 } while(!secp256k1_ecdsa_sig_sign(&both->ecmult_gen_ctx, &sigr, &sigs, &key, &msg, &nonce, NULL));
316
317 /* try signing */
318 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sig_sign(&sign->ecmult_gen_ctx, &sigr, &sigs, &key, &msg, &nonce, NULL));
319 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sig_sign(&both->ecmult_gen_ctx, &sigr, &sigs, &key, &msg, &nonce, NULL));
320
321 /* try verifying */
322 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sig_verify(&sigr, &sigs, &pub, &msg));
323 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sig_verify(&sigr, &sigs, &pub, &msg));
324
325 /* cleanup */
326 if (use_prealloc) {
327 secp256k1_context_preallocated_destroy(none);
328 secp256k1_context_preallocated_destroy(sign);
329 secp256k1_context_preallocated_destroy(vrfy);
330 secp256k1_context_preallocated_destroy(both);
331 secp256k1_context_preallocated_destroy(sttc);
332 free(none_prealloc);
333 free(sign_prealloc);
334 free(vrfy_prealloc);
335 free(both_prealloc);
336 free(sttc_prealloc);
337 } else {
338 secp256k1_context_destroy(none);
339 secp256k1_context_destroy(sign);
340 secp256k1_context_destroy(vrfy);
341 secp256k1_context_destroy(both);
342 secp256k1_context_destroy(sttc);
343 }
344 /* Defined as no-op. */
345 secp256k1_context_destroy(NULL);
346 secp256k1_context_preallocated_destroy(NULL);
347
348}

5154 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xfe, 0xff, 0xff, 0xfc, 0x30,
5155 },
5156 {
5157 /* x on curve, y is from y^2 = x^3 + 8. */

5159 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x01,
5160 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00,
5161 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x03

5164#define SECP256K1_EC_PARSE_TEST_NINVALID (7)

5171 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x01,

5216 const unsigned char pubkeyc[66] = {
5217 /* Serialization of G. */
5218 0x04, 0x79, 0xBE, 0x66, 0x7E, 0xF9, 0xDC, 0xBB, 0xAC, 0x55, 0xA0, 0x62, 0x95, 0xCE, 0x87, 0x0B,
5219 0x07, 0x02, 0x9B, 0xFC, 0xDB, 0x2D, 0xCE, 0x28, 0xD9, 0x59, 0xF2, 0x81, 0x5B, 0x16, 0xF8, 0x17,
5220 0x98, 0x48, 0x3A, 0xDA, 0x77, 0x26, 0xA3, 0xC4, 0x65, 0x5D, 0xA4, 0xFB, 0xFC, 0x0E, 0x11, 0x08,
5221 0xA8, 0xFD, 0x17, 0xB4, 0x48, 0xA6, 0x85, 0x54, 0x19, 0x9C, 0x47, 0xD0, 0x8F, 0xFB, 0x10, 0xD4,
5222 0xB8, 0x00
5223 };
5224 unsigned char sout[65];
5225 unsigned char shortkey[2];
5226 secp256k1_ge ge;
5227 secp256k1_pubkey pubkey;
5228 size_t len;
5229 int32_t i;
5230 int32_t ecount;
5231 int32_t ecount2;
5232 ecount = 0;
5233 /* Nothing should be reading this far into pubkeyc. */
5234 VG_UNDEF(&pubkeyc[65], 1);
5235 secp256k1_context_set_illegal_callback(ctx, counting_illegal_callback_fn, &ecount);
5236 /* Zero length claimed, fail, zeroize, no illegal arg error. */
5237 memset(&pubkey, 0xfe, sizeof(pubkey));
5238 ecount = 0;
5239 VG_UNDEF(shortkey, 2);
5240 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5241 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_parse(ctx, &pubkey, shortkey, 0) == 0);
5242 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5243 CHECK(ecount == 0);
5244 CHECK(secp256k1_pubkey_load(ctx, &ge, &pubkey) == 0);
5245 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5246 /* Length one claimed, fail, zeroize, no illegal arg error. */
5247 for (i = 0; i < 256 ; i++) {
5248 memset(&pubkey, 0xfe, sizeof(pubkey));
5249 ecount = 0;
5250 shortkey[0] = i;
5251 VG_UNDEF(&shortkey[1], 1);
5252 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5253 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_parse(ctx, &pubkey, shortkey, 1) == 0);
5254 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5255 CHECK(ecount == 0);
5256 CHECK(secp256k1_pubkey_load(ctx, &ge, &pubkey) == 0);
5257 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5258 }
5259 /* Length two claimed, fail, zeroize, no illegal arg error. */
5260 for (i = 0; i < 65536 ; i++) {
5261 memset(&pubkey, 0xfe, sizeof(pubkey));
5262 ecount = 0;
5263 shortkey[0] = i & 255;
5264 shortkey[1] = i >> 8;
5265 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5266 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_parse(ctx, &pubkey, shortkey, 2) == 0);
5267 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5268 CHECK(ecount == 0);
5269 CHECK(secp256k1_pubkey_load(ctx, &ge, &pubkey) == 0);
5270 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5271 }
5272 memset(&pubkey, 0xfe, sizeof(pubkey));
5273 ecount = 0;
5274 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5275 /* 33 bytes claimed on otherwise valid input starting with 0x04, fail, zeroize output, no illegal arg error. */
5276 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_parse(ctx, &pubkey, pubkeyc, 33) == 0);
5277 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5278 CHECK(ecount == 0);
5279 CHECK(secp256k1_pubkey_load(ctx, &ge, &pubkey) == 0);
5280 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5281 /* NULL pubkey, illegal arg error. Pubkey isn't rewritten before this step, since it's NULL into the parser. */
5282 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_parse(ctx, NULL, pubkeyc, 65) == 0);
5283 CHECK(ecount == 2);
5284 /* NULL input string. Illegal arg and zeroize output. */
5285 memset(&pubkey, 0xfe, sizeof(pubkey));
5286 ecount = 0;
5287 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5288 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_parse(ctx, &pubkey, NULL, 65) == 0);
5289 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5290 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5291 CHECK(secp256k1_pubkey_load(ctx, &ge, &pubkey) == 0);
5292 CHECK(ecount == 2);
5293 /* 64 bytes claimed on input starting with 0x04, fail, zeroize output, no illegal arg error. */
5294 memset(&pubkey, 0xfe, sizeof(pubkey));
5295 ecount = 0;
5296 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5297 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_parse(ctx, &pubkey, pubkeyc, 64) == 0);
5298 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5299 CHECK(ecount == 0);
5300 CHECK(secp256k1_pubkey_load(ctx, &ge, &pubkey) == 0);
5301 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5302 /* 66 bytes claimed, fail, zeroize output, no illegal arg error. */
5303 memset(&pubkey, 0xfe, sizeof(pubkey));
5304 ecount = 0;
5305 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5306 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_parse(ctx, &pubkey, pubkeyc, 66) == 0);
5307 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5308 CHECK(ecount == 0);
5309 CHECK(secp256k1_pubkey_load(ctx, &ge, &pubkey) == 0);
5310 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5311 /* Valid parse. */
5312 memset(&pubkey, 0, sizeof(pubkey));
5313 ecount = 0;
5314 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5315 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_parse(ctx, &pubkey, pubkeyc, 65) == 1);
5316 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_parse(secp256k1_context_no_precomp, &pubkey, pubkeyc, 65) == 1);
5317 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5318 CHECK(ecount == 0);
5319 VG_UNDEF(&ge, sizeof(ge));
5320 CHECK(secp256k1_pubkey_load(ctx, &ge, &pubkey) == 1);
5321 VG_CHECK(&ge.x, sizeof(ge.x));
5322 VG_CHECK(&ge.y, sizeof(ge.y));
5323 VG_CHECK(&ge.infinity, sizeof(ge.infinity));
5324 ge_equals_ge(&secp256k1_ge_const_g, &ge);
5325 CHECK(ecount == 0);
5326 /* secp256k1_ec_pubkey_serialize illegal args. */
5327 ecount = 0;
5328 len = 65;
5329 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_serialize(ctx, NULL, &len, &pubkey, SECP256K1_EC_UNCOMPRESSED) == 0);
5330 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5331 CHECK(len == 0);
5332 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_serialize(ctx, sout, NULL, &pubkey, SECP256K1_EC_UNCOMPRESSED) == 0);
5333 CHECK(ecount == 2);
5334 len = 65;
5335 VG_UNDEF(sout, 65);
5336 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_serialize(ctx, sout, &len, NULL, SECP256K1_EC_UNCOMPRESSED) == 0);
5337 VG_CHECK(sout, 65);
5338 CHECK(ecount == 3);
5339 CHECK(len == 0);
5340 len = 65;
5341 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_serialize(ctx, sout, &len, &pubkey, ~0) == 0);
5342 CHECK(ecount == 4);
5343 CHECK(len == 0);
5344 len = 65;
5345 VG_UNDEF(sout, 65);
5346 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_serialize(ctx, sout, &len, &pubkey, SECP256K1_EC_UNCOMPRESSED) == 1);
5347 VG_CHECK(sout, 65);
5348 CHECK(ecount == 4);
5349 CHECK(len == 65);
5350 /* Multiple illegal args. Should still set arg error only once. */
5351 ecount = 0;
5352 ecount2 = 11;
5353 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_parse(ctx, NULL, NULL, 65) == 0);
5354 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5355 /* Does the illegal arg callback actually change the behavior? */
5356 secp256k1_context_set_illegal_callback(ctx, uncounting_illegal_callback_fn, &ecount2);
5357 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_parse(ctx, NULL, NULL, 65) == 0);
5358 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5359 CHECK(ecount2 == 10);
5360 secp256k1_context_set_illegal_callback(ctx, NULL, NULL);
5361 /* Try a bunch of prefabbed points with all possible encodings. */
5362 for (i = 0; i < SECP256K1_EC_PARSE_TEST_NVALID; i++) {
5363 ec_pubkey_parse_pointtest(valid[i], 1, 1);
5364 }
5365 for (i = 0; i < SECP256K1_EC_PARSE_TEST_NXVALID; i++) {
5366 ec_pubkey_parse_pointtest(onlyxvalid[i], 1, 0);
5367 }
5368 for (i = 0; i < SECP256K1_EC_PARSE_TEST_NINVALID; i++) {
5369 ec_pubkey_parse_pointtest(invalid[i], 0, 0);
5370 }
5371}

6280 int ret = 0;

6284 certainly_der = 0;
6285 certainly_not_der = 0;

5373 {
5374 const unsigned char orderc[32] = {
5375 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff,
5376 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xfe,

5378 0xbf, 0xd2, 0x5e, 0x8c, 0xd0, 0x36, 0x41, 0x41

5380 const unsigned char zeros[sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey)] = {0x00};
5381 unsigned char ctmp[33];
5382 unsigned char ctmp2[33];
5383 secp256k1_pubkey pubkey;
5384 secp256k1_pubkey pubkey2;
5385 secp256k1_pubkey pubkey_one;
5386 secp256k1_pubkey pubkey_negone;
5387 const secp256k1_pubkey *pubkeys[3];
5388 size_t len;
5389 int32_t ecount;
5390 /* Group order is too large, reject. */
5391 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_verify(ctx, orderc) == 0);
5392 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5393 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_create(ctx, &pubkey, orderc) == 0);
5394 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5395 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey)) == 0);
5396 /* Maximum value is too large, reject. */
5397 memset(ctmp, 255, 32);
5398 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_verify(ctx, ctmp) == 0);
5399 memset(&pubkey, 1, sizeof(pubkey));
5400 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5401 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_create(ctx, &pubkey, ctmp) == 0);
5402 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5403 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey)) == 0);
5404 /* Zero is too small, reject. */
5405 memset(ctmp, 0, 32);
5406 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_verify(ctx, ctmp) == 0);
5407 memset(&pubkey, 1, sizeof(pubkey));
5408 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5409 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_create(ctx, &pubkey, ctmp) == 0);
5410 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5411 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey)) == 0);
5412 /* One must be accepted. */
5413 ctmp[31] = 0x01;
5414 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_verify(ctx, ctmp) == 1);
5415 memset(&pubkey, 0, sizeof(pubkey));
5416 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5417 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_create(ctx, &pubkey, ctmp) == 1);
5418 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5419 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey)) > 0);
5420 pubkey_one = pubkey;
5421 /* Group order + 1 is too large, reject. */
5422 memcpy(ctmp, orderc, 32);
5423 ctmp[31] = 0x42;
5424 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_verify(ctx, ctmp) == 0);
5425 memset(&pubkey, 1, sizeof(pubkey));
5426 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5427 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_create(ctx, &pubkey, ctmp) == 0);
5428 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5429 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey)) == 0);
5430 /* -1 must be accepted. */
5431 ctmp[31] = 0x40;
5432 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_verify(ctx, ctmp) == 1);
5433 memset(&pubkey, 0, sizeof(pubkey));
5434 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5435 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_create(ctx, &pubkey, ctmp) == 1);
5436 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5437 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey)) > 0);
5438 pubkey_negone = pubkey;
5439 /* Tweak of zero leaves the value unchanged. */
5440 memset(ctmp2, 0, 32);
5441 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_tweak_add(ctx, ctmp, ctmp2) == 1);
5442 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(orderc, ctmp, 31) == 0 && ctmp[31] == 0x40);
5443 memcpy(&pubkey2, &pubkey, sizeof(pubkey));
5444 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_add(ctx, &pubkey, ctmp2) == 1);
5445 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, &pubkey2, sizeof(pubkey)) == 0);
5446 /* Multiply tweak of zero zeroizes the output. */
5447 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_tweak_mul(ctx, ctmp, ctmp2) == 0);
5448 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(zeros, ctmp, 32) == 0);
5449 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_mul(ctx, &pubkey, ctmp2) == 0);
5450 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(pubkey)) == 0);
5451 memcpy(&pubkey, &pubkey2, sizeof(pubkey));
5452 /* If seckey_tweak_add or seckey_tweak_mul are called with an overflowing
5453 seckey, the seckey is zeroized. */
5454 memcpy(ctmp, orderc, 32);
5455 memset(ctmp2, 0, 32);
5456 ctmp2[31] = 0x01;
5457 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_verify(ctx, ctmp2) == 1);
5458 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_verify(ctx, ctmp) == 0);
5459 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_tweak_add(ctx, ctmp, ctmp2) == 0);
5460 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(zeros, ctmp, 32) == 0);
5461 memcpy(ctmp, orderc, 32);
5462 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_tweak_mul(ctx, ctmp, ctmp2) == 0);
5463 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(zeros, ctmp, 32) == 0);
5464 /* If seckey_tweak_add or seckey_tweak_mul are called with an overflowing
5465 tweak, the seckey is zeroized. */
5466 memcpy(ctmp, orderc, 32);
5467 ctmp[31] = 0x40;
5468 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_tweak_add(ctx, ctmp, orderc) == 0);
5469 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(zeros, ctmp, 32) == 0);
5470 memcpy(ctmp, orderc, 32);
5471 ctmp[31] = 0x40;
5472 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_tweak_mul(ctx, ctmp, orderc) == 0);
5473 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(zeros, ctmp, 32) == 0);
5474 memcpy(ctmp, orderc, 32);
5475 ctmp[31] = 0x40;
5476 /* If pubkey_tweak_add or pubkey_tweak_mul are called with an overflowing
5477 tweak, the pubkey is zeroized. */
5478 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_add(ctx, &pubkey, orderc) == 0);
5479 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(pubkey)) == 0);
5480 memcpy(&pubkey, &pubkey2, sizeof(pubkey));
5481 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_mul(ctx, &pubkey, orderc) == 0);
5482 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(pubkey)) == 0);
5483 memcpy(&pubkey, &pubkey2, sizeof(pubkey));
5484 /* If the resulting key in secp256k1_ec_seckey_tweak_add and
5485 * secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_add is 0 the functions fail and in the latter
5486 * case the pubkey is zeroized. */
5487 memcpy(ctmp, orderc, 32);
5488 ctmp[31] = 0x40;
5489 memset(ctmp2, 0, 32);
5490 ctmp2[31] = 1;
5491 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_tweak_add(ctx, ctmp2, ctmp) == 0);
5492 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(zeros, ctmp2, 32) == 0);
5493 ctmp2[31] = 1;
5494 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_add(ctx, &pubkey, ctmp2) == 0);
5495 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(pubkey)) == 0);
5496 memcpy(&pubkey, &pubkey2, sizeof(pubkey));
5497 /* Tweak computation wraps and results in a key of 1. */
5498 ctmp2[31] = 2;
5499 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_tweak_add(ctx, ctmp2, ctmp) == 1);
5500 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(ctmp2, zeros, 31) == 0 && ctmp2[31] == 1);
5501 ctmp2[31] = 2;
5502 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_add(ctx, &pubkey, ctmp2) == 1);
5503 ctmp2[31] = 1;
5504 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_create(ctx, &pubkey2, ctmp2) == 1);
5505 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, &pubkey2, sizeof(pubkey)) == 0);
5506 /* Tweak mul * 2 = 1+1. */
5507 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_add(ctx, &pubkey, ctmp2) == 1);
5508 ctmp2[31] = 2;
5509 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_mul(ctx, &pubkey2, ctmp2) == 1);
5510 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, &pubkey2, sizeof(pubkey)) == 0);
5511 /* Test argument errors. */
5512 ecount = 0;
5513 secp256k1_context_set_illegal_callback(ctx, counting_illegal_callback_fn, &ecount);
5514 CHECK(ecount == 0);
5515 /* Zeroize pubkey on parse error. */
5516 memset(&pubkey, 0, 32);
5517 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_add(ctx, &pubkey, ctmp2) == 0);
5518 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5519 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(pubkey)) == 0);
5520 memcpy(&pubkey, &pubkey2, sizeof(pubkey));
5521 memset(&pubkey2, 0, 32);
5522 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_mul(ctx, &pubkey2, ctmp2) == 0);
5523 CHECK(ecount == 2);
5524 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey2, zeros, sizeof(pubkey2)) == 0);
5525 /* Plain argument errors. */
5526 ecount = 0;
5527 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_verify(ctx, ctmp) == 1);
5528 CHECK(ecount == 0);
5529 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_verify(ctx, NULL) == 0);
5530 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5531 ecount = 0;
5532 memset(ctmp2, 0, 32);
5533 ctmp2[31] = 4;
5534 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_add(ctx, NULL, ctmp2) == 0);
5535 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5536 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_add(ctx, &pubkey, NULL) == 0);
5537 CHECK(ecount == 2);
5538 ecount = 0;
5539 memset(ctmp2, 0, 32);
5540 ctmp2[31] = 4;
5541 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_mul(ctx, NULL, ctmp2) == 0);
5542 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5543 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_mul(ctx, &pubkey, NULL) == 0);
5544 CHECK(ecount == 2);
5545 ecount = 0;
5546 memset(ctmp2, 0, 32);
5547 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_tweak_add(ctx, NULL, ctmp2) == 0);
5548 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5549 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_tweak_add(ctx, ctmp, NULL) == 0);
5550 CHECK(ecount == 2);
5551 ecount = 0;
5552 memset(ctmp2, 0, 32);
5553 ctmp2[31] = 1;
5554 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_tweak_mul(ctx, NULL, ctmp2) == 0);
5555 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5556 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_tweak_mul(ctx, ctmp, NULL) == 0);
5557 CHECK(ecount == 2);
5558 ecount = 0;
5559 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_create(ctx, NULL, ctmp) == 0);
5560 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5561 memset(&pubkey, 1, sizeof(pubkey));
5562 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_create(ctx, &pubkey, NULL) == 0);
5563 CHECK(ecount == 2);
5564 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey)) == 0);
5565 /* secp256k1_ec_pubkey_combine tests. */
5566 ecount = 0;
5567 pubkeys[0] = &pubkey_one;
5568 VG_UNDEF(&pubkeys[0], sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey *));
5569 VG_UNDEF(&pubkeys[1], sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey *));
5570 VG_UNDEF(&pubkeys[2], sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey *));
5571 memset(&pubkey, 255, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey));
5572 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey));
5573 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_combine(ctx, &pubkey, pubkeys, 0) == 0);
5574 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey));
5575 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey)) == 0);
5576 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5577 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_combine(ctx, NULL, pubkeys, 1) == 0);
5578 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey)) == 0);
5579 CHECK(ecount == 2);
5580 memset(&pubkey, 255, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey));
5581 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey));
5582 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_combine(ctx, &pubkey, NULL, 1) == 0);
5583 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey));
5584 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey)) == 0);
5585 CHECK(ecount == 3);
5586 pubkeys[0] = &pubkey_negone;
5587 memset(&pubkey, 255, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey));
5588 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey));
5589 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_combine(ctx, &pubkey, pubkeys, 1) == 1);
5590 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey));
5591 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey)) > 0);
5592 CHECK(ecount == 3);
5593 len = 33;
5594 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_serialize(ctx, ctmp, &len, &pubkey, SECP256K1_EC_COMPRESSED) == 1);
5595 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_serialize(ctx, ctmp2, &len, &pubkey_negone, SECP256K1_EC_COMPRESSED) == 1);
5596 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(ctmp, ctmp2, 33) == 0);
5597 /* Result is infinity. */
5598 pubkeys[0] = &pubkey_one;
5599 pubkeys[1] = &pubkey_negone;
5600 memset(&pubkey, 255, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey));
5601 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey));
5602 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_combine(ctx, &pubkey, pubkeys, 2) == 0);
5603 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey));
5604 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey)) == 0);
5605 CHECK(ecount == 3);
5606 /* Passes through infinity but comes out one. */
5607 pubkeys[2] = &pubkey_one;
5608 memset(&pubkey, 255, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey));
5609 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey));
5610 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_combine(ctx, &pubkey, pubkeys, 3) == 1);
5611 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey));
5612 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey)) > 0);
5613 CHECK(ecount == 3);
5614 len = 33;
5615 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_serialize(ctx, ctmp, &len, &pubkey, SECP256K1_EC_COMPRESSED) == 1);
5616 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_serialize(ctx, ctmp2, &len, &pubkey_one, SECP256K1_EC_COMPRESSED) == 1);
5617 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(ctmp, ctmp2, 33) == 0);
5618 /* Adds to two. */
5619 pubkeys[1] = &pubkey_one;
5620 memset(&pubkey, 255, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey));
5621 VG_UNDEF(&pubkey, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey));
5622 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_combine(ctx, &pubkey, pubkeys, 2) == 1);
5623 VG_CHECK(&pubkey, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey));
5624 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&pubkey, zeros, sizeof(secp256k1_pubkey)) > 0);
5625 CHECK(ecount == 3);
5626 secp256k1_context_set_illegal_callback(ctx, NULL, NULL);
5627}

◆ run_eckey_negate_test()

void run_eckey_negate_test ( void  )

Definition at line 5629 of file tests.c.

5629 {
5630 unsigned char seckey[32];
5631 unsigned char seckey_tmp[32];
5632
5633 random_scalar_order_b32(seckey);
5634 memcpy(seckey_tmp, seckey, 32);
5635
5636 /* Verify negation changes the key and changes it back */
5637 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_negate(ctx, seckey) == 1);
5638 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(seckey, seckey_tmp, 32) != 0);
5639 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_negate(ctx, seckey) == 1);
5640 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(seckey, seckey_tmp, 32) == 0);
5641
5642 /* Check that privkey alias gives same result */
5643 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_negate(ctx, seckey) == 1);
5644 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_privkey_negate(ctx, seckey_tmp) == 1);
5645 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(seckey, seckey_tmp, 32) == 0);
5646
5647 /* Negating all 0s fails */
5648 memset(seckey, 0, 32);
5649 memset(seckey_tmp, 0, 32);
5650 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_negate(ctx, seckey) == 0);
5651 /* Check that seckey is not modified */
5652 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(seckey, seckey_tmp, 32) == 0);
5653
5654 /* Negating an overflowing seckey fails and the seckey is zeroed. In this
5655 * test, the seckey has 16 random bytes to ensure that ec_seckey_negate
5656 * doesn't just set seckey to a constant value in case of failure. */
5657 random_scalar_order_b32(seckey);
5658 memset(seckey, 0xFF, 16);
5659 memset(seckey_tmp, 0, 32);
5660 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_seckey_negate(ctx, seckey) == 0);
5661 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(seckey, seckey_tmp, 32) == 0);
5662}

◆ run_ecmult_chain()

void run_ecmult_chain ( void  )

Definition at line 3535 of file tests.c.

3535 {
3536 /* random starting point A (on the curve) */
3537 secp256k1_gej a = SECP256K1_GEJ_CONST(
3538 0x8b30bbe9, 0xae2a9906, 0x96b22f67, 0x0709dff3,
3539 0x727fd8bc, 0x04d3362c, 0x6c7bf458, 0xe2846004,
3540 0xa357ae91, 0x5c4a6528, 0x1309edf2, 0x0504740f,
3541 0x0eb33439, 0x90216b4f, 0x81063cb6, 0x5f2f7e0f
3542 );
3543 /* two random initial factors xn and gn */
3544 secp256k1_scalar xn = SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(
3545 0x84cc5452, 0xf7fde1ed, 0xb4d38a8c, 0xe9b1b84c,
3546 0xcef31f14, 0x6e569be9, 0x705d357a, 0x42985407
3547 );
3548 secp256k1_scalar gn = SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(
3549 0xa1e58d22, 0x553dcd42, 0xb2398062, 0x5d4c57a9,
3550 0x6e9323d4, 0x2b3152e5, 0xca2c3990, 0xedc7c9de
3551 );
3552 /* two small multipliers to be applied to xn and gn in every iteration: */
3553 static const secp256k1_scalar xf = SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0x1337);
3554 static const secp256k1_scalar gf = SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0x7113);
3555 /* accumulators with the resulting coefficients to A and G */
3556 secp256k1_scalar ae = SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1);
3557 secp256k1_scalar ge = SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
3558 /* actual points */
3559 secp256k1_gej x;
3560 secp256k1_gej x2;
3561 int i;
3562
3563 /* the point being computed */
3564 x = a;
3565 for (i = 0; i < 200*count; i++) {
3566 /* in each iteration, compute X = xn*X + gn*G; */
3567 secp256k1_ecmult(&x, &x, &xn, &gn);
3568 /* also compute ae and ge: the actual accumulated factors for A and G */
3569 /* if X was (ae*A+ge*G), xn*X + gn*G results in (xn*ae*A + (xn*ge+gn)*G) */
3570 secp256k1_scalar_mul(&ae, &ae, &xn);
3571 secp256k1_scalar_mul(&ge, &ge, &xn);
3572 secp256k1_scalar_add(&ge, &ge, &gn);
3573 /* modify xn and gn */
3574 secp256k1_scalar_mul(&xn, &xn, &xf);
3575 secp256k1_scalar_mul(&gn, &gn, &gf);
3576
3577 /* verify */
3578 if (i == 19999) {
3579 /* expected result after 19999 iterations */
3580 secp256k1_gej rp = SECP256K1_GEJ_CONST(
3581 0xD6E96687, 0xF9B10D09, 0x2A6F3543, 0x9D86CEBE,
3582 0xA4535D0D, 0x409F5358, 0x6440BD74, 0xB933E830,
3583 0xB95CBCA2, 0xC77DA786, 0x539BE8FD, 0x53354D2D,
3584 0x3B4F566A, 0xE6580454, 0x07ED6015, 0xEE1B2A88
3585 );
3586
3587 secp256k1_gej_neg(&rp, &rp);
3588 secp256k1_gej_add_var(&rp, &rp, &x, NULL);
3589 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&rp));
3590 }
3591 }
3592 /* redo the computation, but directly with the resulting ae and ge coefficients: */
3593 secp256k1_ecmult(&x2, &a, &ae, &ge);
3594 secp256k1_gej_neg(&x2, &x2);
3595 secp256k1_gej_add_var(&x2, &x2, &x, NULL);
3596 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&x2));
3597}
secp256k1_ecmult
static void secp256k1_ecmult(secp256k1_gej *r, const secp256k1_gej *a, const secp256k1_scalar *na, const secp256k1_scalar *ng)
secp256k1_gej_is_infinity
static int secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(const secp256k1_gej *a)
secp256k1_gej_add_var
static void secp256k1_gej_add_var(secp256k1_gej *r, const secp256k1_gej *a, const secp256k1_gej *b, secp256k1_fe *rzr)
secp256k1_scalar_add
static int secp256k1_scalar_add(secp256k1_scalar *r, const secp256k1_scalar *a, const secp256k1_scalar *b)
secp256k1_scalar_mul
static void secp256k1_scalar_mul(secp256k1_scalar *r, const secp256k1_scalar *a, const secp256k1_scalar *b)

4849 0x8e, 0x8b, 0xd6, 0xc0, 0x61, 0x79, 0x34, 0x6e,

4854 0x8b, 0x65, 0x8e, 0xea, 0x86, 0xae, 0x3c, 0x95,
4855 0x90, 0xb6, 0x77, 0xa4, 0x8c, 0x76, 0xd9, 0xec,

4859 /* For every combination of 6 bit positions out of 256, restricted to
4860 * 20-bit windows (i.e., the first and last bit position are no more than
4861 * 19 bits apart), all 64 bit patterns occur in the input scalars used in
4862 * this test. */
4863 CONDITIONAL_TEST(1, "test_ecmult_constants_sha 1024") {
4864 test_ecmult_constants_sha(4808378u, 1024, expected32_6bit20);
4865 }
4866

4868 * patterns occur in the input scalars used in this test. */
4869 CONDITIONAL_TEST(3, "test_ecmult_constants_sha 2048") {
4870 test_ecmult_constants_sha(1607366309u, 2048, expected32_8bit8);
4871 }

void run_field_misc ( void  )

2474 {
2475 secp256k1_fe x;
2476 secp256k1_fe y;
2477 secp256k1_fe z;
2478 secp256k1_fe q;
2479 secp256k1_fe fe5 = SECP256K1_FE_CONST(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 5);
2480 int i, j;
2481 for (i = 0; i < 5*count; i++) {
2482 secp256k1_fe_storage xs, ys, zs;
2483 random_fe(&x);
2484 random_fe_non_zero(&y);
2485 /* Test the fe equality and comparison operations. */
2486 CHECK(secp256k1_fe_cmp_var(&x, &x) == 0);
2487 CHECK(secp256k1_fe_equal_var(&x, &x));
2488 z = x;
2489 secp256k1_fe_add(&z,&y);
2490 /* Test fe conditional move; z is not normalized here. */
2491 q = x;
2492 secp256k1_fe_cmov(&x, &z, 0);
2493#ifdef VERIFY
2494 CHECK(x.normalized && x.magnitude == 1);
2495#endif
2496 secp256k1_fe_cmov(&x, &x, 1);
2497 CHECK(!fe_identical(&x, &z));
2498 CHECK(fe_identical(&x, &q));
2499 secp256k1_fe_cmov(&q, &z, 1);
2500#ifdef VERIFY
2501 CHECK(!q.normalized && q.magnitude == z.magnitude);
2502#endif
2503 CHECK(fe_identical(&q, &z));
2504 secp256k1_fe_normalize_var(&x);
2505 secp256k1_fe_normalize_var(&z);
2506 CHECK(!secp256k1_fe_equal_var(&x, &z));
2507 secp256k1_fe_normalize_var(&q);
2508 secp256k1_fe_cmov(&q, &z, (i&1));
2509#ifdef VERIFY
2510 CHECK(q.normalized && q.magnitude == 1);
2511#endif
2512 for (j = 0; j < 6; j++) {
2513 secp256k1_fe_negate(&z, &z, j+1);
2514 secp256k1_fe_normalize_var(&q);
2515 secp256k1_fe_cmov(&q, &z, (j&1));
2516#ifdef VERIFY
2517 CHECK((q.normalized != (j&1)) && q.magnitude == ((j&1) ? z.magnitude : 1));
2518#endif
2519 }
2520 secp256k1_fe_normalize_var(&z);
2521 /* Test storage conversion and conditional moves. */
2522 secp256k1_fe_to_storage(&xs, &x);
2523 secp256k1_fe_to_storage(&ys, &y);
2524 secp256k1_fe_to_storage(&zs, &z);
2525 secp256k1_fe_storage_cmov(&zs, &xs, 0);
2526 secp256k1_fe_storage_cmov(&zs, &zs, 1);
2527 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&xs, &zs, sizeof(xs)) != 0);
2528 secp256k1_fe_storage_cmov(&ys, &xs, 1);
2529 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&xs, &ys, sizeof(xs)) == 0);
2530 secp256k1_fe_from_storage(&x, &xs);
2531 secp256k1_fe_from_storage(&y, &ys);
2532 secp256k1_fe_from_storage(&z, &zs);
2533 /* Test that mul_int, mul, and add agree. */
2534 secp256k1_fe_add(&y, &x);
2535 secp256k1_fe_add(&y, &x);
2536 z = x;
2537 secp256k1_fe_mul_int(&z, 3);
2538 CHECK(check_fe_equal(&y, &z));
2539 secp256k1_fe_add(&y, &x);
2540 secp256k1_fe_add(&z, &x);
2541 CHECK(check_fe_equal(&z, &y));
2542 z = x;
2543 secp256k1_fe_mul_int(&z, 5);
2544 secp256k1_fe_mul(&q, &x, &fe5);
2545 CHECK(check_fe_equal(&z, &q));
2546 secp256k1_fe_negate(&x, &x, 1);
2547 secp256k1_fe_add(&z, &x);
2548 secp256k1_fe_add(&q, &x);
2549 CHECK(check_fe_equal(&y, &z));
2550 CHECK(check_fe_equal(&q, &y));
2551 }
2552}

515 int i;
516 for (i = 0; i < 6; i++) {
517 secp256k1_hmac_sha256 hasher;
518 unsigned char out[32];
519 secp256k1_hmac_sha256_initialize(&hasher, (const unsigned char*)(keys[i]), strlen(keys[i]));
520 secp256k1_hmac_sha256_write(&hasher, (const unsigned char*)(inputs[i]), strlen(inputs[i]));
521 secp256k1_hmac_sha256_finalize(&hasher, out);
522 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(out, outputs[i], 32) == 0);
523 if (strlen(inputs[i]) > 0) {
524 int split = secp256k1_testrand_int(strlen(inputs[i]));
525 secp256k1_hmac_sha256_initialize(&hasher, (const unsigned char*)(keys[i]), strlen(keys[i]));
526 secp256k1_hmac_sha256_write(&hasher, (const unsigned char*)(inputs[i]), split);
527 secp256k1_hmac_sha256_write(&hasher, (const unsigned char*)(inputs[i] + split), strlen(inputs[i]) - split);
528 secp256k1_hmac_sha256_finalize(&hasher, out);

530 }

2941 int i, var, testrand;
2942 unsigned char b32[32];
2943 secp256k1_fe x_fe;
2944 secp256k1_scalar x_scalar;
2945 memset(b32, 0, sizeof(b32));
2946 /* Test fixed test cases through test_inverse_{scalar,field}, both ways. */
2947 for (i = 0; (size_t)i < sizeof(fe_cases)/sizeof(fe_cases[0]); ++i) {
2948 for (var = 0; var <= 1; ++var) {
2949 test_inverse_field(&x_fe, &fe_cases[i][0], var);
2950 check_fe_equal(&x_fe, &fe_cases[i][1]);
2951 test_inverse_field(&x_fe, &fe_cases[i][1], var);
2952 check_fe_equal(&x_fe, &fe_cases[i][0]);
2953 }
2954 }
2955 for (i = 0; (size_t)i < sizeof(scalar_cases)/sizeof(scalar_cases[0]); ++i) {
2956 for (var = 0; var <= 1; ++var) {
2957 test_inverse_scalar(&x_scalar, &scalar_cases[i][0], var);
2958 CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_eq(&x_scalar, &scalar_cases[i][1]));
2959 test_inverse_scalar(&x_scalar, &scalar_cases[i][1], var);
2960 CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_eq(&x_scalar, &scalar_cases[i][0]));
2961 }
2962 }
2963 /* Test inputs 0..999 and their respective negations. */
2964 for (i = 0; i < 1000; ++i) {
2965 b32[31] = i & 0xff;
2966 b32[30] = (i >> 8) & 0xff;
2967 secp256k1_scalar_set_b32(&x_scalar, b32, NULL);
2968 secp256k1_fe_set_b32(&x_fe, b32);
2969 for (var = 0; var <= 1; ++var) {
2970 test_inverse_scalar(NULL, &x_scalar, var);
2971 test_inverse_field(NULL, &x_fe, var);
2972 }
2973 secp256k1_scalar_negate(&x_scalar, &x_scalar);
2974 secp256k1_fe_negate(&x_fe, &x_fe, 1);
2975 for (var = 0; var <= 1; ++var) {
2976 test_inverse_scalar(NULL, &x_scalar, var);
2977 test_inverse_field(NULL, &x_fe, var);
2978 }
2979 }
2980 /* test 128*count random inputs; half with testrand256_test, half with testrand256 */
2981 for (testrand = 0; testrand <= 1; ++testrand) {
2982 for (i = 0; i < 64 * count; ++i) {
2983 (testrand ? secp256k1_testrand256_test : secp256k1_testrand256)(b32);
2984 secp256k1_scalar_set_b32(&x_scalar, b32, NULL);
2985 secp256k1_fe_set_b32(&x_fe, b32);
2986 for (var = 0; var <= 1; ++var) {
2987 test_inverse_scalar(NULL, &x_scalar, var);
2988 test_inverse_field(NULL, &x_fe, var);
2989 }
2990 }
2991 }
2992}

1540 0x8134, 0x1f6a, 0x712d, 0x1f03, 0x03b2, 0xecac, 0x377d, 0xfef9}}
1541 };
1542
1543 int i, j, ok;
1544
1545 /* Test known inputs/outputs */
1546 for (i = 0; (size_t)i < sizeof(CASES) / sizeof(CASES[0]); ++i) {
1547 uint16_t out[16];
1548 test_modinv32_uint16(out, CASES[i][0], CASES[i][1]);
1549 for (j = 0; j < 16; ++j) CHECK(out[j] == CASES[i][2][j]);
1550#ifdef SECP256K1_WIDEMUL_INT128
1551 test_modinv64_uint16(out, CASES[i][0], CASES[i][1]);
1552 for (j = 0; j < 16; ++j) CHECK(out[j] == CASES[i][2][j]);
1553#endif
1554 }
1555
1556 for (i = 0; i < 100 * count; ++i) {
1557 /* 256-bit numbers in 16-uint16_t's notation */
1558 static const uint16_t ZERO[16] = {0};
1559 uint16_t xd[16]; /* the number (in range [0,2^256)) to be inverted */
1560 uint16_t md[16]; /* the modulus (odd, in range [3,2^256)) */
1561 uint16_t id[16]; /* the inverse of xd mod md */
1562
1563 /* generate random xd and md, so that md is odd, md>1, xd<md, and gcd(xd,md)=1 */
1564 do {
1565 /* generate random xd and md (with many subsequent 0s and 1s) */
1566 secp256k1_testrand256_test((unsigned char*)xd);
1567 secp256k1_testrand256_test((unsigned char*)md);
1568 md[0] |= 1; /* modulus must be odd */
1569 /* If modulus is 1, find another one. */
1570 ok = md[0] != 1;
1571 for (j = 1; j < 16; ++j) ok |= md[j] != 0;
1572 mulmod256(xd, xd, NULL, md); /* Make xd = xd mod md */
1573 } while (!(ok && coprime(xd, md)));
1574
1575 test_modinv32_uint16(id, xd, md);
1576#ifdef SECP256K1_WIDEMUL_INT128
1577 test_modinv64_uint16(id, xd, md);
1578#endif
1579
1580 /* In a few cases, also test with input=0 */
1581 if (i < count) {
1582 test_modinv32_uint16(id, ZERO, md);
1583#ifdef SECP256K1_WIDEMUL_INT128
1584 test_modinv64_uint16(id, ZERO, md);
1585#endif
1586 }
1587 }
1588}
test_modinv32_uint16
void test_modinv32_uint16(uint16_t *out, const uint16_t *in, const uint16_t *mod)

5979
5980 secp256k1_context_set_illegal_callback(ctx, counting_illegal_callback_fn, &ecount);
5981 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_cmp(ctx, NULL, &pk2) < 0);
5982 CHECK(ecount == 1);
5983 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_cmp(ctx, &pk1, NULL) > 0);
5984 CHECK(ecount == 2);
5985 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_cmp(ctx, &pk1, &pk2) < 0);
5986 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_cmp(ctx, &pk2, &pk1) > 0);
5987 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_cmp(ctx, &pk1, &pk1) == 0);
5988 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_cmp(ctx, &pk2, &pk2) == 0);
5989 CHECK(ecount == 2);
5990 {
5991 secp256k1_pubkey pk_tmp;
5992 memset(&pk_tmp, 0, sizeof(pk_tmp)); /* illegal pubkey */
5993 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_cmp(ctx, &pk_tmp, &pk2) < 0);
5994 CHECK(ecount == 3);
5995 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_cmp(ctx, &pk_tmp, &pk_tmp) == 0);
5996 CHECK(ecount == 5);
5997 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_cmp(ctx, &pk2, &pk_tmp) > 0);
5998 CHECK(ecount == 6);
5999 }
6000
6001 secp256k1_context_set_illegal_callback(ctx, NULL, NULL);
6002
6003 /* Make pk2 the same as pk1 but with 3 rather than 2. Note that in
6004 * an uncompressed encoding, these would have the opposite ordering */
6005 pk1_ser[0] = 3;
6006 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_parse(ctx, &pk2, pk1_ser, sizeof(pk1_ser)) == 1);
6007 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_cmp(ctx, &pk1, &pk2) < 0);

549 secp256k1_rfc6979_hmac_sha256 rng;
550 unsigned char out[32];
551 int i;

554 for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
555 secp256k1_rfc6979_hmac_sha256_generate(&rng, out, 32);
556 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(out, out1[i], 32) == 0);
557 }

559

562 secp256k1_rfc6979_hmac_sha256_generate(&rng, out, 32);
563 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(out, out1[i], 32) != 0);
564 }
565 secp256k1_rfc6979_hmac_sha256_finalize(&rng);

571 }
572 secp256k1_rfc6979_hmac_sha256_finalize(&rng);
573}
secp256k1_rfc6979_hmac_sha256_generate

◆ run_scalar_set_b32_seckey_tests()

void run_scalar_set_b32_seckey_tests ( void  )

Definition at line 1758 of file tests.c.

1758 {
1759 unsigned char b32[32];
1760 secp256k1_scalar s1;
1761 secp256k1_scalar s2;
1762
1763 /* Usually set_b32 and set_b32_seckey give the same result */
1764 random_scalar_order_b32(b32);
1765 secp256k1_scalar_set_b32(&s1, b32, NULL);
1766 CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_set_b32_seckey(&s2, b32) == 1);
1767 CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_eq(&s1, &s2) == 1);
1768
1769 memset(b32, 0, sizeof(b32));
1770 CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_set_b32_seckey(&s2, b32) == 0);
1771 memset(b32, 0xFF, sizeof(b32));
1772 CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_set_b32_seckey(&s2, b32) == 0);
1773}
secp256k1_scalar_set_b32_seckey
static int secp256k1_scalar_set_b32_seckey(secp256k1_scalar *r, const unsigned char *bin)

References CHECK, random_scalar_order_b32(), secp256k1_scalar_eq(), secp256k1_scalar_set_b32(), and secp256k1_scalar_set_b32_seckey().

1784 {
1785 /* (-1)+1 should be zero. */
1786 secp256k1_scalar s, o;
1787 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&s, 1);
1788 CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_is_one(&s));
1789 secp256k1_scalar_negate(&o, &s);

◆ run_scratch_tests()

void run_scratch_tests ( void  )

Definition at line 350 of file tests.c.

350 {
351 const size_t adj_alloc = ((500 + ALIGNMENT - 1) / ALIGNMENT) * ALIGNMENT;
352
353 int32_t ecount = 0;
354 size_t checkpoint;
355 size_t checkpoint_2;
356 secp256k1_context *none = secp256k1_context_create(SECP256K1_CONTEXT_NONE);
357 secp256k1_scratch_space *scratch;
358 secp256k1_scratch_space local_scratch;
359
360 /* Test public API */
361 secp256k1_context_set_illegal_callback(none, counting_illegal_callback_fn, &ecount);
362 secp256k1_context_set_error_callback(none, counting_illegal_callback_fn, &ecount);
363
364 scratch = secp256k1_scratch_space_create(none, 1000);
365 CHECK(scratch != NULL);
366 CHECK(ecount == 0);
367
368 /* Test internal API */
369 CHECK(secp256k1_scratch_max_allocation(&none->error_callback, scratch, 0) == 1000);
370 CHECK(secp256k1_scratch_max_allocation(&none->error_callback, scratch, 1) == 1000 - (ALIGNMENT - 1));
371 CHECK(scratch->alloc_size == 0);
372 CHECK(scratch->alloc_size % ALIGNMENT == 0);
373
374 /* Allocating 500 bytes succeeds */
375 checkpoint = secp256k1_scratch_checkpoint(&none->error_callback, scratch);
376 CHECK(secp256k1_scratch_alloc(&none->error_callback, scratch, 500) != NULL);
377 CHECK(secp256k1_scratch_max_allocation(&none->error_callback, scratch, 0) == 1000 - adj_alloc);
378 CHECK(secp256k1_scratch_max_allocation(&none->error_callback, scratch, 1) == 1000 - adj_alloc - (ALIGNMENT - 1));
379 CHECK(scratch->alloc_size != 0);
380 CHECK(scratch->alloc_size % ALIGNMENT == 0);
381
382 /* Allocating another 501 bytes fails */
383 CHECK(secp256k1_scratch_alloc(&none->error_callback, scratch, 501) == NULL);
384 CHECK(secp256k1_scratch_max_allocation(&none->error_callback, scratch, 0) == 1000 - adj_alloc);
385 CHECK(secp256k1_scratch_max_allocation(&none->error_callback, scratch, 1) == 1000 - adj_alloc - (ALIGNMENT - 1));
386 CHECK(scratch->alloc_size != 0);
387 CHECK(scratch->alloc_size % ALIGNMENT == 0);
388
389 /* ...but it succeeds once we apply the checkpoint to undo it */
390 secp256k1_scratch_apply_checkpoint(&none->error_callback, scratch, checkpoint);
391 CHECK(scratch->alloc_size == 0);
392 CHECK(secp256k1_scratch_max_allocation(&none->error_callback, scratch, 0) == 1000);
393 CHECK(secp256k1_scratch_alloc(&none->error_callback, scratch, 500) != NULL);
394 CHECK(scratch->alloc_size != 0);
395
396 /* try to apply a bad checkpoint */
397 checkpoint_2 = secp256k1_scratch_checkpoint(&none->error_callback, scratch);
398 secp256k1_scratch_apply_checkpoint(&none->error_callback, scratch, checkpoint);
399 CHECK(ecount == 0);
400 secp256k1_scratch_apply_checkpoint(&none->error_callback, scratch, checkpoint_2); /* checkpoint_2 is after checkpoint */
401 CHECK(ecount == 1);
402 secp256k1_scratch_apply_checkpoint(&none->error_callback, scratch, (size_t) -1); /* this is just wildly invalid */
403 CHECK(ecount == 2);
404
405 /* try to use badly initialized scratch space */
406 secp256k1_scratch_space_destroy(none, scratch);
407 memset(&local_scratch, 0, sizeof(local_scratch));
408 scratch = &local_scratch;
409 CHECK(!secp256k1_scratch_max_allocation(&none->error_callback, scratch, 0));
410 CHECK(ecount == 3);
411 CHECK(secp256k1_scratch_alloc(&none->error_callback, scratch, 500) == NULL);
412 CHECK(ecount == 4);
413 secp256k1_scratch_space_destroy(none, scratch);
414 CHECK(ecount == 5);
415
416 /* Test that large integers do not wrap around in a bad way */
417 scratch = secp256k1_scratch_space_create(none, 1000);
418 /* Try max allocation with a large number of objects. Only makes sense if
419 * ALIGNMENT is greater than 1 because otherwise the objects take no extra
420 * space. */
421 CHECK(ALIGNMENT <= 1 || !secp256k1_scratch_max_allocation(&none->error_callback, scratch, (SIZE_MAX / (ALIGNMENT - 1)) + 1));
422 /* Try allocating SIZE_MAX to test wrap around which only happens if
423 * ALIGNMENT > 1, otherwise it returns NULL anyway because the scratch
424 * space is too small. */
425 CHECK(secp256k1_scratch_alloc(&none->error_callback, scratch, SIZE_MAX) == NULL);
426 secp256k1_scratch_space_destroy(none, scratch);
427
428 /* cleanup */
429 secp256k1_scratch_space_destroy(none, NULL); /* no-op */
430 secp256k1_context_destroy(none);
431}

◆ run_secp256k1_memczero_test()

void run_secp256k1_memczero_test ( void  )

Definition at line 6691 of file tests.c.

6691 {
6692 unsigned char buf1[6] = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6};
6693 unsigned char buf2[sizeof(buf1)];
6694
6695 /* secp256k1_memczero(..., ..., 0) is a noop. */
6696 memcpy(buf2, buf1, sizeof(buf1));
6697 secp256k1_memczero(buf1, sizeof(buf1), 0);
6698 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(buf1, buf2, sizeof(buf1)) == 0);
6699
6700 /* secp256k1_memczero(..., ..., 1) zeros the buffer. */
6701 memset(buf2, 0, sizeof(buf2));
6702 secp256k1_memczero(buf1, sizeof(buf1) , 1);
6703 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(buf1, buf2, sizeof(buf1)) == 0);
6704}

static SECP256K1_INLINE void secp256k1_memczero(void *s, size_t len, int flag)

470 };
471 int i;
472 for (i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
473 unsigned char out[32];
474 secp256k1_sha256 hasher;
475 secp256k1_sha256_initialize(&hasher);
476 secp256k1_sha256_write(&hasher, (const unsigned char*)(inputs[i]), strlen(inputs[i]));
477 secp256k1_sha256_finalize(&hasher, out);
478 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(out, outputs[i], 32) == 0);
479 if (strlen(inputs[i]) > 0) {
480 int split = secp256k1_testrand_int(strlen(inputs[i]));
481 secp256k1_sha256_initialize(&hasher);
482 secp256k1_sha256_write(&hasher, (const unsigned char*)(inputs[i]), split);
483 secp256k1_sha256_write(&hasher, (const unsigned char*)(inputs[i] + split), strlen(inputs[i]) - split);
484 secp256k1_sha256_finalize(&hasher, out);
485 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(out, outputs[i], 32) == 0);
486 }
487 }
488}

1608
1609 {
1610 int i;
1611 /* Test that fetching groups of 4 bits from a scalar and recursing n(i)=16*n(i-1)+p(i) reconstructs it. */
1612 secp256k1_scalar n;
1613 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&n, 0);
1614 for (i = 0; i < 256; i += 4) {
1615 secp256k1_scalar t;
1616 int j;
1617 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&t, secp256k1_scalar_get_bits(&s, 256 - 4 - i, 4));
1618 for (j = 0; j < 4; j++) {
1619 secp256k1_scalar_add(&n, &n, &n);
1620 }
1621 secp256k1_scalar_add(&n, &n, &t);
1622 }
1623 CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_eq(&n, &s));
1624 }
1625
1626 {
1627 /* Test that fetching groups of randomly-sized bits from a scalar and recursing n(i)=b*n(i-1)+p(i) reconstructs it. */
1628 secp256k1_scalar n;
1629 int i = 0;
1630 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&n, 0);
1631 while (i < 256) {
1632 secp256k1_scalar t;
1633 int j;
1634 int now = secp256k1_testrand_int(15) + 1;
1635 if (now + i > 256) {
1636 now = 256 - i;
1637 }
1638 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&t, secp256k1_scalar_get_bits_var(&s, 256 - now - i, now));
1639 for (j = 0; j < now; j++) {
1640 secp256k1_scalar_add(&n, &n, &n);
1641 }
1642 secp256k1_scalar_add(&n, &n, &t);
1643 i += now;
1644 }
1645 CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_eq(&n, &s));
1646 }

1654 int low;

1656 int expected = r.d[0] % (1 << shift);
1657 low = secp256k1_scalar_shr_int(&r, shift);
1658 CHECK(expected == low);
1659 }
1660 }

1662 {

1664 secp256k1_scalar r1, r2;
1665 secp256k1_scalar_add(&r1, &s1, &s2);
1666 secp256k1_scalar_add(&r2, &s2, &s1);
1667 CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_eq(&r1, &r2));

1670 {

1676 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&b, 1);
1677 CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_is_one(&b));
1678 for (i = 0; i < bit; i++) {
1679 secp256k1_scalar_add(&b, &b, &b);
1680 }

1682 r2 = s1;
1683 if (!secp256k1_scalar_add(&r1, &r1, &b)) {
1684 /* No overflow happened. */
1685 secp256k1_scalar_cadd_bit(&r2, bit, 1);
1686 CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_eq(&r1, &r2));
1687 /* cadd is a noop when flag is zero */
1688 secp256k1_scalar_cadd_bit(&r2, bit, 0);
1689 CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_eq(&r1, &r2));

1701 {

1705 secp256k1_scalar_add(&r1, &r1, &s);

1723 secp256k1_scalar r1, r2, t;

1725 secp256k1_scalar_mul(&r1, &r1, &s);
1726 secp256k1_scalar_mul(&r2, &s1, &s);

◆ test_add_neg_y_diff_x()

void test_add_neg_y_diff_x ( void  )

Definition at line 3276 of file tests.c.

3276 {
3277 /* The point of this test is to check that we can add two points
3278 * whose y-coordinates are negatives of each other but whose x
3279 * coordinates differ. If the x-coordinates were the same, these
3280 * points would be negatives of each other and their sum is
3281 * infinity. This is cool because it "covers up" any degeneracy
3282 * in the addition algorithm that would cause the xy coordinates
3283 * of the sum to be wrong (since infinity has no xy coordinates).
3284 * HOWEVER, if the x-coordinates are different, infinity is the
3285 * wrong answer, and such degeneracies are exposed. This is the
3286 * root of https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/issues/257
3287 * which this test is a regression test for.
3288 *
3289 * These points were generated in sage as
3290 * # secp256k1 params
3291 * F = FiniteField (0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFEFFFFFC2F)
3292 * C = EllipticCurve ([F (0), F (7)])
3293 * G = C.lift_x(0x79BE667EF9DCBBAC55A06295CE870B07029BFCDB2DCE28D959F2815B16F81798)
3294 * N = FiniteField(G.order())
3295 *
3296 * # endomorphism values (lambda is 1^{1/3} in N, beta is 1^{1/3} in F)
3297 * x = polygen(N)
3298 * lam = (1 - x^3).roots()[1][0]
3299 *
3300 * # random "bad pair"
3301 * P = C.random_element()
3302 * Q = -int(lam) * P
3303 * print " P: %x %x" % P.xy()
3304 * print " Q: %x %x" % Q.xy()
3305 * print "P + Q: %x %x" % (P + Q).xy()
3306 */
3307 secp256k1_gej aj = SECP256K1_GEJ_CONST(
3308 0x8d24cd95, 0x0a355af1, 0x3c543505, 0x44238d30,
3309 0x0643d79f, 0x05a59614, 0x2f8ec030, 0xd58977cb,
3310 0x001e337a, 0x38093dcd, 0x6c0f386d, 0x0b1293a8,
3311 0x4d72c879, 0xd7681924, 0x44e6d2f3, 0x9190117d
3312 );
3313 secp256k1_gej bj = SECP256K1_GEJ_CONST(
3314 0xc7b74206, 0x1f788cd9, 0xabd0937d, 0x164a0d86,
3315 0x95f6ff75, 0xf19a4ce9, 0xd013bd7b, 0xbf92d2a7,
3316 0xffe1cc85, 0xc7f6c232, 0x93f0c792, 0xf4ed6c57,
3317 0xb28d3786, 0x2897e6db, 0xbb192d0b, 0x6e6feab2
3318 );
3319 secp256k1_gej sumj = SECP256K1_GEJ_CONST(
3320 0x671a63c0, 0x3efdad4c, 0x389a7798, 0x24356027,
3321 0xb3d69010, 0x278625c3, 0x5c86d390, 0x184a8f7a,
3322 0x5f6409c2, 0x2ce01f2b, 0x511fd375, 0x25071d08,
3323 0xda651801, 0x70e95caf, 0x8f0d893c, 0xbed8fbbe
3324 );
3325 secp256k1_ge b;
3326 secp256k1_gej resj;
3327 secp256k1_ge res;
3328 secp256k1_ge_set_gej(&b, &bj);
3329
3330 secp256k1_gej_add_var(&resj, &aj, &bj, NULL);
3331 secp256k1_ge_set_gej(&res, &resj);
3332 ge_equals_gej(&res, &sumj);
3333
3334 secp256k1_gej_add_ge(&resj, &aj, &b);
3335 secp256k1_ge_set_gej(&res, &resj);
3336 ge_equals_gej(&res, &sumj);
3337
3338 secp256k1_gej_add_ge_var(&resj, &aj, &b, NULL);
3339 secp256k1_ge_set_gej(&res, &resj);
3340 ge_equals_gej(&res, &sumj);
3341}

void test_constant_wnaf ( const secp256k1_scalar *  number,

)

Definition at line 4529 of file tests.c.

4529 {
4530 secp256k1_scalar x, shift;
4531 int wnaf[256] = {0};
4532 int i;
4533 int skew;
4534 int bits = 256;
4535 secp256k1_scalar num = *number;
4536 secp256k1_scalar scalar_skew;
4537
4538 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&x, 0);
4539 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&shift, 1 << w);
4540 for (i = 0; i < 16; ++i) {
4541 secp256k1_scalar_shr_int(&num, 8);
4542 }
4543 bits = 128;
4544 skew = secp256k1_wnaf_const(wnaf, &num, w, bits);
4545
4546 for (i = WNAF_SIZE_BITS(bits, w); i >= 0; --i) {
4547 secp256k1_scalar t;
4548 int v = wnaf[i];
4549 CHECK(v != 0); /* check nonzero */
4550 CHECK(v & 1); /* check parity */
4551 CHECK(v > -(1 << w)); /* check range above */
4552 CHECK(v < (1 << w)); /* check range below */
4553
4554 secp256k1_scalar_mul(&x, &x, &shift);
4555 if (v >= 0) {
4556 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&t, v);
4557 } else {
4558 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&t, -v);
4559 secp256k1_scalar_negate(&t, &t);
4560 }
4561 secp256k1_scalar_add(&x, &x, &t);
4562 }
4563 /* Skew num because when encoding numbers as odd we use an offset */
4564 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&scalar_skew, skew);
4565 secp256k1_scalar_add(&num, &num, &scalar_skew);
4566 CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_eq(&x, &num));
4567}

)

6025 {
6026 static const unsigned char zeroes[32] = {0};
6027
6028 int ret = 0;
6029
6030 secp256k1_ecdsa_signature sig_der;
6031 unsigned char roundtrip_der[2048];
6032 unsigned char compact_der[64];
6033 size_t len_der = 2048;
6034 int parsed_der = 0, valid_der = 0, roundtrips_der = 0;
6035
6036 secp256k1_ecdsa_signature sig_der_lax;
6037 unsigned char roundtrip_der_lax[2048];
6038 unsigned char compact_der_lax[64];
6039 size_t len_der_lax = 2048;
6040 int parsed_der_lax = 0, valid_der_lax = 0, roundtrips_der_lax = 0;
6041
6042 parsed_der = secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_parse_der(ctx, &sig_der, sig, siglen);
6043 if (parsed_der) {
6044 ret |= (!secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_serialize_compact(ctx, compact_der, &sig_der)) << 0;
6045 valid_der = (secp256k1_memcmp_var(compact_der, zeroes, 32) != 0) && (secp256k1_memcmp_var(compact_der + 32, zeroes, 32) != 0);
6046 }
6047 if (valid_der) {
6048 ret |= (!secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_serialize_der(ctx, roundtrip_der, &len_der, &sig_der)) << 1;
6049 roundtrips_der = (len_der == siglen) && secp256k1_memcmp_var(roundtrip_der, sig, siglen) == 0;
6050 }
6051
6052 parsed_der_lax = ecdsa_signature_parse_der_lax(ctx, &sig_der_lax, sig, siglen);
6053 if (parsed_der_lax) {
6054 ret |= (!secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_serialize_compact(ctx, compact_der_lax, &sig_der_lax)) << 10;
6055 valid_der_lax = (secp256k1_memcmp_var(compact_der_lax, zeroes, 32) != 0) && (secp256k1_memcmp_var(compact_der_lax + 32, zeroes, 32) != 0);
6056 }
6057 if (valid_der_lax) {
6058 ret |= (!secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_serialize_der(ctx, roundtrip_der_lax, &len_der_lax, &sig_der_lax)) << 11;
6059 roundtrips_der_lax = (len_der_lax == siglen) && secp256k1_memcmp_var(roundtrip_der_lax, sig, siglen) == 0;
6060 }
6061
6062 if (certainly_der) {
6063 ret |= (!parsed_der) << 2;
6064 }
6065 if (certainly_not_der) {
6066 ret |= (parsed_der) << 17;
6067 }
6068 if (valid_der) {
6069 ret |= (!roundtrips_der) << 3;
6070 }
6071
6072 if (valid_der) {
6073 ret |= (!roundtrips_der_lax) << 12;
6074 ret |= (len_der != len_der_lax) << 13;
6075 ret |= ((len_der != len_der_lax) || (secp256k1_memcmp_var(roundtrip_der_lax, roundtrip_der, len_der) != 0)) << 14;
6076 }
6077 ret |= (roundtrips_der != roundtrips_der_lax) << 15;
6078 if (parsed_der) {
6079 ret |= (!parsed_der_lax) << 16;
6080 }
6081
6082 return ret;
6083}
