6475 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00,
6476 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00,
6477 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00,
6478 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x01,
6479 };
6480 static const unsigned char nonce2[32] = {
6481 0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,
6482 0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFE,
6483 0xBA,0xAE,0xDC,0xE6,0xAF,0x48,0xA0,0x3B,
6484 0xBF,0xD2,0x5E,0x8C,0xD0,0x36,0x41,0x40
6485 };
6486 const unsigned char key[32] = {
6487 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00,
6488 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00,
6489 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00,
6490 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x01,
6491 };
6492 unsigned char msg[32] = {
6493 0x86, 0x41, 0x99, 0x81, 0x06, 0x23, 0x44, 0x53,
6494 0xaa, 0x5f, 0x9d, 0x6a, 0x31, 0x78, 0xf4, 0xf7,
6495 0xb8, 0x12, 0xe0, 0x0b, 0x81, 0x7a, 0x77, 0x62,
6496 0x65, 0xdf, 0xdd, 0x31, 0xb9, 0x3e, 0x29, 0xa9,
6497 };
6498 ecount = 0;
6499 secp256k1_context_set_illegal_callback(ctx, counting_illegal_callback_fn, &ecount);
6500 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sign(ctx, &sig, msg, key, precomputed_nonce_function, nonce) == 0);
6501 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sign(ctx, &sig, msg, key, precomputed_nonce_function, nonce2) == 0);
6502 msg[31] = 0xaa;
6503 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sign(ctx, &sig, msg, key, precomputed_nonce_function, nonce) == 1);
6504 CHECK(ecount == 0);
6505 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sign(ctx, NULL, msg, key, precomputed_nonce_function, nonce2) == 0);
6506 CHECK(ecount == 1);
6507 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sign(ctx, &sig, NULL, key, precomputed_nonce_function, nonce2) == 0);
6508 CHECK(ecount == 2);
6509 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sign(ctx, &sig, msg, NULL, precomputed_nonce_function, nonce2) == 0);
6510 CHECK(ecount == 3);
6511 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sign(ctx, &sig, msg, key, precomputed_nonce_function, nonce2) == 1);
6512 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_create(ctx, &pubkey, key) == 1);
6513 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_verify(ctx, NULL, msg, &pubkey) == 0);
6514 CHECK(ecount == 4);
6515 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_verify(ctx, &sig, NULL, &pubkey) == 0);
6516 CHECK(ecount == 5);
6517 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_verify(ctx, &sig, msg, NULL) == 0);
6518 CHECK(ecount == 6);
6519 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_verify(ctx, &sig, msg, &pubkey) == 1);
6520 CHECK(ecount == 6);
6521 CHECK(secp256k1_ec_pubkey_create(ctx, &pubkey, NULL) == 0);
6522 CHECK(ecount == 7);
6523 /* That pubkeyload fails via an ARGCHECK is a little odd but makes sense because pubkeys are an opaque data type. */
6524 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_verify(ctx, &sig, msg, &pubkey) == 0);
6525 CHECK(ecount == 8);
6526 siglen = 72;
6527 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_serialize_der(ctx, NULL, &siglen, &sig) == 0);
6528 CHECK(ecount == 9);
6529 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_serialize_der(ctx, signature, NULL, &sig) == 0);
6530 CHECK(ecount == 10);
6531 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_serialize_der(ctx, signature, &siglen, NULL) == 0);
6532 CHECK(ecount == 11);
6533 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_serialize_der(ctx, signature, &siglen, &sig) == 1);
6534 CHECK(ecount == 11);
6535 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_parse_der(ctx, NULL, signature, siglen) == 0);
6536 CHECK(ecount == 12);
6537 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_parse_der(ctx, &sig, NULL, siglen) == 0);
6538 CHECK(ecount == 13);
6539 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_parse_der(ctx, &sig, signature, siglen) == 1);
6540 CHECK(ecount == 13);
6541 siglen = 10;
6542 /* Too little room for a signature does not fail via ARGCHECK. */
6543 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_serialize_der(ctx, signature, &siglen, &sig) == 0);
6544 CHECK(ecount == 13);
6545 ecount = 0;
6546 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_normalize(ctx, NULL, NULL) == 0);
6547 CHECK(ecount == 1);
6548 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_serialize_compact(ctx, NULL, &sig) == 0);
6549 CHECK(ecount == 2);
6550 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_serialize_compact(ctx, signature, NULL) == 0);
6551 CHECK(ecount == 3);
6552 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_serialize_compact(ctx, signature, &sig) == 1);
6553 CHECK(ecount == 3);
6554 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_parse_compact(ctx, NULL, signature) == 0);
6555 CHECK(ecount == 4);
6556 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_parse_compact(ctx, &sig, NULL) == 0);
6557 CHECK(ecount == 5);
6558 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_parse_compact(ctx, &sig, signature) == 1);
6559 CHECK(ecount == 5);
6560 memset(signature, 255, 64);
6561 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_parse_compact(ctx, &sig, signature) == 0);
6562 CHECK(ecount == 5);
6563 secp256k1_context_set_illegal_callback(ctx, NULL, NULL);
6564 }
6565
6566 /* Nonce function corner cases. */
6567 for (t = 0; t < 2; t++) {
6568 static const unsigned char zero[32] = {0x00};
6569 int i;
6570 unsigned char key[32];
6571 unsigned char msg[32];
6572 secp256k1_ecdsa_signature sig2;
6573 secp256k1_scalar sr[512], ss;
6574 const unsigned char *extra;
6575 extra = t == 0 ? NULL : zero;
6576 memset(msg, 0, 32);
6577 msg[31] = 1;
6578 /* High key results in signature failure. */
6579 memset(key, 0xFF, 32);
6580 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sign(ctx, &sig, msg, key, NULL, extra) == 0);
6581 CHECK(is_empty_signature(&sig));
6582 /* Zero key results in signature failure. */
6583 memset(key, 0, 32);
6584 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sign(ctx, &sig, msg, key, NULL, extra) == 0);
6585 CHECK(is_empty_signature(&sig));
6586 /* Nonce function failure results in signature failure. */
6587 key[31] = 1;
6588 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sign(ctx, &sig, msg, key, nonce_function_test_fail, extra) == 0);
6589 CHECK(is_empty_signature(&sig));
6590 /* The retry loop successfully makes its way to the first good value. */
6591 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sign(ctx, &sig, msg, key, nonce_function_test_retry, extra) == 1);
6592 CHECK(!is_empty_signature(&sig));
6593 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sign(ctx, &sig2, msg, key, nonce_function_rfc6979, extra) == 1);
6594 CHECK(!is_empty_signature(&sig2));
6595 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&sig, &sig2, sizeof(sig)) == 0);
6596 /* The default nonce function is deterministic. */
6597 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sign(ctx, &sig2, msg, key, NULL, extra) == 1);
6598 CHECK(!is_empty_signature(&sig2));
6599 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&sig, &sig2, sizeof(sig)) == 0);
6600 /* The default nonce function changes output with different messages. */
6601 for(i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
6602 int j;
6603 msg[0] = i;
6604 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sign(ctx, &sig2, msg, key, NULL, extra) == 1);
6605 CHECK(!is_empty_signature(&sig2));
6606 secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_load(ctx, &sr[i], &ss, &sig2);
6607 for (j = 0; j < i; j++) {
6608 CHECK(!secp256k1_scalar_eq(&sr[i], &sr[j]));
6609 }
6610 }
6611 msg[0] = 0;
6612 msg[31] = 2;
6613 /* The default nonce function changes output with different keys. */
6614 for(i = 256; i < 512; i++) {
6615 int j;
6616 key[0] = i - 256;
6617 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sign(ctx, &sig2, msg, key, NULL, extra) == 1);
6618 CHECK(!is_empty_signature(&sig2));
6619 secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_load(ctx, &sr[i], &ss, &sig2);
6620 for (j = 0; j < i; j++) {
6621 CHECK(!secp256k1_scalar_eq(&sr[i], &sr[j]));
6622 }
6623 }
6624 key[0] = 0;
6625 }
6626
6627 {
6628 /* Check that optional nonce arguments do not have equivalent effect. */
6629 const unsigned char zeros[32] = {0};
6630 unsigned char nonce[32];
6631 unsigned char nonce2[32];
6632 unsigned char nonce3[32];
6633 unsigned char nonce4[32];
6634 VG_UNDEF(nonce,32);
6635 VG_UNDEF(nonce2,32);
6636 VG_UNDEF(nonce3,32);
6637 VG_UNDEF(nonce4,32);
6638 CHECK(nonce_function_rfc6979(nonce, zeros, zeros, NULL, NULL, 0) == 1);
6639 VG_CHECK(nonce,32);
6640 CHECK(nonce_function_rfc6979(nonce2, zeros, zeros, zeros, NULL, 0) == 1);
6641 VG_CHECK(nonce2,32);
6642 CHECK(nonce_function_rfc6979(nonce3, zeros, zeros, NULL, (void *)zeros, 0) == 1);
6643 VG_CHECK(nonce3,32);
6644 CHECK(nonce_function_rfc6979(nonce4, zeros, zeros, zeros, (void *)zeros, 0) == 1);
6645 VG_CHECK(nonce4,32);
6646 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(nonce, nonce2, 32) != 0);
6647 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(nonce, nonce3, 32) != 0);
6648 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(nonce, nonce4, 32) != 0);
6649 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(nonce2, nonce3, 32) != 0);
6650 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(nonce2, nonce4, 32) != 0);
6651 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(nonce3, nonce4, 32) != 0);
6652 }
6653
6654
6655 /* Privkey export where pubkey is the point at infinity. */
6656 {
6657 unsigned char privkey[300];
6658 unsigned char seckey[32] = {
6659 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff,
6660 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xfe,
6661 0xba, 0xae, 0xdc, 0xe6, 0xaf, 0x48, 0xa0, 0x3b,
6662 0xbf, 0xd2, 0x5e, 0x8c, 0xd0, 0x36, 0x41, 0x41,
6663 };
6664 size_t outlen = 300;
6665 CHECK(!ec_privkey_export_der(ctx, privkey, &outlen, seckey, 0));
6666 outlen = 300;
6667 CHECK(!ec_privkey_export_der(ctx, privkey, &outlen, seckey, 1));
6668 }

5802
5803 /* Optionally tweak the keys using addition. */
5804 if (secp256k1_testrand_int(3) == 0) {
5805 int ret1;
5806 int ret2;
5807 int ret3;
5808 unsigned char rnd[32];

5814 ret2 = secp256k1_ec_pubkey_tweak_add(ctx, &pubkey, rnd);

5817 CHECK(ret1 == ret2);
5818 CHECK(ret2 == ret3);
5819 if (ret1 == 0) {
5820 return;

5851 /* Sign. */

5862 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&signature[0], &signature[2], sizeof(signature[0])) != 0);
5863 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&signature[0], &signature[3], sizeof(signature[0])) != 0);
5864 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&signature[1], &signature[2], sizeof(signature[0])) != 0);

5866 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&signature[2], &signature[3], sizeof(signature[0])) != 0);
5867 /* Verify. */
5868 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_verify(ctx, &signature[0], message, &pubkey) == 1);
5869 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_verify(ctx, &signature[1], message, &pubkey) == 1);
5870 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_verify(ctx, &signature[2], message, &pubkey) == 1);
5871 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_verify(ctx, &signature[3], message, &pubkey) == 1);
5872 /* Test lower-S form, malleate, verify and fail, test again, malleate again */
5873 CHECK(!secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_normalize(ctx, NULL, &signature[0]));
5874 secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_load(ctx, &r, &s, &signature[0]);
5875 secp256k1_scalar_negate(&s, &s);
5876 secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_save(&signature[5], &r, &s);
5877 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_verify(ctx, &signature[5], message, &pubkey) == 0);
5878 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_normalize(ctx, NULL, &signature[5]));
5879 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_normalize(ctx, &signature[5], &signature[5]));
5880 CHECK(!secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_normalize(ctx, NULL, &signature[5]));
5881 CHECK(!secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_normalize(ctx, &signature[5], &signature[5]));
5882 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_verify(ctx, &signature[5], message, &pubkey) == 1);
5883 secp256k1_scalar_negate(&s, &s);
5884 secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_save(&signature[5], &r, &s);
5885 CHECK(!secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_normalize(ctx, NULL, &signature[5]));
5886 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_verify(ctx, &signature[5], message, &pubkey) == 1);
5887 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&signature[5], &signature[0], 64) == 0);
5888
5889 /* Serialize/parse DER and verify again */
5890 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_serialize_der(ctx, sig, &siglen, &signature[0]) == 1);
5891 memset(&signature[0], 0, sizeof(signature[0]));
5892 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_parse_der(ctx, &signature[0], sig, siglen) == 1);
5893 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_verify(ctx, &signature[0], message, &pubkey) == 1);
5894 /* Serialize/destroy/parse DER and verify again. */
5895 siglen = 74;
5896 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_serialize_der(ctx, sig, &siglen, &signature[0]) == 1);
5897 sig[secp256k1_testrand_int(siglen)] += 1 + secp256k1_testrand_int(255);
5898 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_parse_der(ctx, &signature[0], sig, siglen) == 0 ||
5899 secp256k1_ecdsa_verify(ctx, &signature[0], message, &pubkey) == 0);
5900}

5680 random_scalar_order_test(&key);
5681 secp256k1_ecmult_gen(&ctx->ecmult_gen_ctx, &pubj, &key);
5682 secp256k1_ge_set_gej(&pub, &pubj);
5683 getrec = secp256k1_testrand_bits(1);
5684 /* The specific way in which this conditional is written sidesteps a potential bug in clang.
5685 See the commit messages of the commit that introduced this comment for details. */
5686 if (getrec) {
5687 random_sign(&sigr, &sigs, &key, &msg, &recid);
5688 CHECK(recid >= 0 && recid < 4);
5689 } else {
5690 random_sign(&sigr, &sigs, &key, &msg, NULL);
5691 }
5692 CHECK(secp256k1_ecdsa_sig_verify(&sigr, &sigs, &pub, &msg));
5693 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&one, 1);
5694 secp256k1_scalar_add(&msg, &msg, &one);
5695 CHECK(!secp256k1_ecdsa_sig_verify(&sigr, &sigs, &pub, &msg));
5696}

4724 {
4725 /* Compute x*G in 6 different ways, serialize it uncompressed, and feed it into acc. */
4726 secp256k1_gej rj1, rj2, rj3, rj4, rj5, rj6, gj, infj;
4727 secp256k1_ge r;
4728 const secp256k1_scalar zero = SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
4729 unsigned char bytes[65];
4730 size_t size = 65;
4731 secp256k1_gej_set_ge(&gj, &secp256k1_ge_const_g);
4732 secp256k1_gej_set_infinity(&infj);
4733 secp256k1_ecmult_gen(&ctx->ecmult_gen_ctx, &rj1, x);
4734 secp256k1_ecmult(&rj2, &gj, x, &zero);
4735 secp256k1_ecmult(&rj3, &infj, &zero, x);
4736 secp256k1_ecmult_multi_var(NULL, scratch, &rj4, x, NULL, NULL, 0);
4737 secp256k1_ecmult_multi_var(NULL, scratch, &rj5, &zero, test_ecmult_accumulate_cb, (void*)x, 1);
4738 secp256k1_ecmult_const(&rj6, &secp256k1_ge_const_g, x, 256);
4739 secp256k1_ge_set_gej_var(&r, &rj1);
4740 ge_equals_gej(&r, &rj2);
4741 ge_equals_gej(&r, &rj3);
4742 ge_equals_gej(&r, &rj4);
4743 ge_equals_gej(&r, &rj5);
4744 ge_equals_gej(&r, &rj6);
4745 if (secp256k1_ge_is_infinity(&r)) {
4746 /* Store infinity as 0x00 */
4747 const unsigned char zerobyte[1] = {0};
4748 secp256k1_sha256_write(acc, zerobyte, 1);
4749 } else {
4750 /* Store other points using their uncompressed serialization. */

4752 CHECK(size == 65);
4753 secp256k1_sha256_write(acc, bytes, size);
4754 }

◆ test_ecmult_constants_2bit()

void test_ecmult_constants_2bit ( void  )

Definition at line 4757 of file tests.c.

4757 {
4758 /* Using test_ecmult_accumulate, test ecmult for:
4759 * - For i in 0..36:
4760 * - Key i
4761 * - Key -i
4762 * - For i in 0..255:
4763 * - For j in 1..255 (only odd values):
4764 * - Key (j*2^i) mod order
4765 */
4766 secp256k1_scalar x;
4767 secp256k1_sha256 acc;
4768 unsigned char b32[32];
4769 int i, j;
4770 secp256k1_scratch_space *scratch = secp256k1_scratch_space_create(ctx, 65536);
4771
4772 /* Expected hash of all the computed points; created with an independent
4773 * implementation. */
4774 static const unsigned char expected32[32] = {
4775 0xe4, 0x71, 0x1b, 0x4d, 0x14, 0x1e, 0x68, 0x48,
4776 0xb7, 0xaf, 0x47, 0x2b, 0x4c, 0xd2, 0x04, 0x14,
4777 0x3a, 0x75, 0x87, 0x60, 0x1a, 0xf9, 0x63, 0x60,
4778 0xd0, 0xcb, 0x1f, 0xaa, 0x85, 0x9a, 0xb7, 0xb4
4779 };
4780 secp256k1_sha256_initialize(&acc);
4781 for (i = 0; i <= 36; ++i) {
4782 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&x, i);
4783 test_ecmult_accumulate(&acc, &x, scratch);
4784 secp256k1_scalar_negate(&x, &x);
4785 test_ecmult_accumulate(&acc, &x, scratch);
4786 };
4787 for (i = 0; i < 256; ++i) {
4788 for (j = 1; j < 256; j += 2) {
4789 int k;
4790 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&x, j);
4791 for (k = 0; k < i; ++k) secp256k1_scalar_add(&x, &x, &x);
4792 test_ecmult_accumulate(&acc, &x, scratch);
4793 }
4794 }
4795 secp256k1_sha256_finalize(&acc, b32);
4796 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(b32, expected32, 32) == 0);
4797
4798 secp256k1_scratch_space_destroy(ctx, scratch);
4799}

Definition at line 4801 of file tests.c.

4801 {
4802 /* Using test_ecmult_accumulate, test ecmult for:
4803 * - Key 0
4804 * - Key 1
4805 * - Key -1
4806 * - For i in range(iter):
4807 * - Key SHA256(LE32(prefix) || LE16(i))
4808 */
4809 secp256k1_scalar x;
4810 secp256k1_sha256 acc;
4811 unsigned char b32[32];
4812 unsigned char inp[6];
4813 size_t i;
4814 secp256k1_scratch_space *scratch = secp256k1_scratch_space_create(ctx, 65536);
4815
4816 inp[0] = prefix & 0xFF;
4817 inp[1] = (prefix >> 8) & 0xFF;
4818 inp[2] = (prefix >> 16) & 0xFF;
4819 inp[3] = (prefix >> 24) & 0xFF;
4820 secp256k1_sha256_initialize(&acc);
4821 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&x, 0);
4822 test_ecmult_accumulate(&acc, &x, scratch);
4823 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&x, 1);
4824 test_ecmult_accumulate(&acc, &x, scratch);
4825 secp256k1_scalar_negate(&x, &x);
4826 test_ecmult_accumulate(&acc, &x, scratch);
4827
4828 for (i = 0; i < iter; ++i) {
4829 secp256k1_sha256 gen;
4830 inp[4] = i & 0xff;
4831 inp[5] = (i >> 8) & 0xff;
4832 secp256k1_sha256_initialize(&gen);
4833 secp256k1_sha256_write(&gen, inp, sizeof(inp));
4834 secp256k1_sha256_finalize(&gen, b32);
4835 secp256k1_scalar_set_b32(&x, b32, NULL);
4836 test_ecmult_accumulate(&acc, &x, scratch);
4837 }
4838 secp256k1_sha256_finalize(&acc, b32);
4839 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(b32, expected32, 32) == 0);
4840
4841 secp256k1_scratch_space_destroy(ctx, scratch);
4842}

3858 {
3859 int ncount;

3868 data.pt = pt;
3869 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&szero, 0);
3870
3871 /* No points to multiply */
3872 CHECK(ecmult_multi(&ctx->error_callback, scratch, &r, NULL, ecmult_multi_callback, &data, 0));
3873
3874 /* Check 1- and 2-point multiplies against ecmult */
3875 for (ncount = 0; ncount < count; ncount++) {
3876 secp256k1_ge ptg;
3877 secp256k1_gej ptgj;
3878 random_scalar_order(&sc[0]);

3884 pt[1] = secp256k1_ge_const_g;
3885
3886 /* only G scalar */

3889 secp256k1_gej_neg(&r2, &r2);
3890 secp256k1_gej_add_var(&r, &r, &r2, NULL);
3891 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&r));
3892
3893 /* 1-point */

3898 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&r));
3899
3900 /* Try to multiply 1 point, but callback returns false */
3901 CHECK(!ecmult_multi(&ctx->error_callback, scratch, &r, &szero, ecmult_multi_false_callback, &data, 1));
3902
3903 /* 2-point */

3906 secp256k1_gej_neg(&r2, &r2);

3908 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&r));
3909
3910 /* 2-point with G scalar */

3915 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&r));
3916 }
3917
3918 /* Check infinite outputs of various forms */
3919 for (ncount = 0; ncount < count; ncount++) {
3920 secp256k1_ge ptg;
3921 size_t i, j;
3922 size_t sizes[] = { 2, 10, 32 };
3923
3924 for (j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
3925 for (i = 0; i < 32; i++) {
3926 random_scalar_order(&sc[i]);
3927 secp256k1_ge_set_infinity(&pt[i]);
3928 }
3929 CHECK(ecmult_multi(&ctx->error_callback, scratch, &r, &szero, ecmult_multi_callback, &data, sizes[j]));
3930 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&r));
3931 }
3932
3933 for (j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
3934 for (i = 0; i < 32; i++) {
3935 random_group_element_test(&ptg);
3936 pt[i] = ptg;
3937 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&sc[i], 0);
3938 }
3939 CHECK(ecmult_multi(&ctx->error_callback, scratch, &r, &szero, ecmult_multi_callback, &data, sizes[j]));
3940 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&r));
3941 }
3942
3943 for (j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
3944 random_group_element_test(&ptg);
3945 for (i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
3946 random_scalar_order(&sc[2*i]);
3947 secp256k1_scalar_negate(&sc[2*i + 1], &sc[2*i]);
3948 pt[2 * i] = ptg;
3949 pt[2 * i + 1] = ptg;
3950 }
3951
3952 CHECK(ecmult_multi(&ctx->error_callback, scratch, &r, &szero, ecmult_multi_callback, &data, sizes[j]));
3953 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&r));
3954
3955 random_scalar_order(&sc[0]);
3956 for (i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
3957 random_group_element_test(&ptg);
3958
3959 sc[2*i] = sc[0];
3960 sc[2*i+1] = sc[0];
3961 pt[2 * i] = ptg;
3962 secp256k1_ge_neg(&pt[2*i+1], &pt[2*i]);
3963 }
3964
3965 CHECK(ecmult_multi(&ctx->error_callback, scratch, &r, &szero, ecmult_multi_callback, &data, sizes[j]));
3966 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&r));
3967 }
3968
3969 random_group_element_test(&ptg);
3970 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&sc[0], 0);
3971 pt[0] = ptg;
3972 for (i = 1; i < 32; i++) {
3973 pt[i] = ptg;
3974
3975 random_scalar_order(&sc[i]);
3976 secp256k1_scalar_add(&sc[0], &sc[0], &sc[i]);
3977 secp256k1_scalar_negate(&sc[i], &sc[i]);
3978 }
3979
3980 CHECK(ecmult_multi(&ctx->error_callback, scratch, &r, &szero, ecmult_multi_callback, &data, 32));
3981 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&r));
3982 }
3983
3984 /* Check random points, constant scalar */
3985 for (ncount = 0; ncount < count; ncount++) {
3986 size_t i;
3987 secp256k1_gej_set_infinity(&r);
3988
3989 random_scalar_order(&sc[0]);
3990 for (i = 0; i < 20; i++) {
3991 secp256k1_ge ptg;
3992 sc[i] = sc[0];
3993 random_group_element_test(&ptg);
3994 pt[i] = ptg;
3995 secp256k1_gej_add_ge_var(&r, &r, &pt[i], NULL);
3996 }
3997
3998 secp256k1_ecmult(&r2, &r, &sc[0], &szero);
3999 CHECK(ecmult_multi(&ctx->error_callback, scratch, &r, &szero, ecmult_multi_callback, &data, 20));
4000 secp256k1_gej_neg(&r2, &r2);
4001 secp256k1_gej_add_var(&r, &r, &r2, NULL);
4002 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&r));
4003 }
4004
4005 /* Check random scalars, constant point */
4006 for (ncount = 0; ncount < count; ncount++) {
4007 size_t i;
4008 secp256k1_ge ptg;
4009 secp256k1_gej p0j;
4010 secp256k1_scalar rs;
4011 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&rs, 0);
4012
4013 random_group_element_test(&ptg);
4014 for (i = 0; i < 20; i++) {
4015 random_scalar_order(&sc[i]);
4016 pt[i] = ptg;
4017 secp256k1_scalar_add(&rs, &rs, &sc[i]);
4018 }
4019
4020 secp256k1_gej_set_ge(&p0j, &pt[0]);
4021 secp256k1_ecmult(&r2, &p0j, &rs, &szero);
4022 CHECK(ecmult_multi(&ctx->error_callback, scratch, &r, &szero, ecmult_multi_callback, &data, 20));
4023 secp256k1_gej_neg(&r2, &r2);
4024 secp256k1_gej_add_var(&r, &r, &r2, NULL);
4025 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&r));
4026 }
4027
4028 /* Sanity check that zero scalars don't cause problems */
4029 for (ncount = 0; ncount < 20; ncount++) {
4030 random_scalar_order(&sc[ncount]);
4031 random_group_element_test(&pt[ncount]);
4032 }
4033
4034 secp256k1_scalar_clear(&sc[0]);
4035 CHECK(ecmult_multi(&ctx->error_callback, scratch, &r, &szero, ecmult_multi_callback, &data, 20));
4036 secp256k1_scalar_clear(&sc[1]);
4037 secp256k1_scalar_clear(&sc[2]);
4038 secp256k1_scalar_clear(&sc[3]);
4039 secp256k1_scalar_clear(&sc[4]);
4040 CHECK(ecmult_multi(&ctx->error_callback, scratch, &r, &szero, ecmult_multi_callback, &data, 6));
4041 CHECK(ecmult_multi(&ctx->error_callback, scratch, &r, &szero, ecmult_multi_callback, &data, 5));
4042 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&r));
4043
4044 /* Run through s0*(t0*P) + s1*(t1*P) exhaustively for many small values of s0, s1, t0, t1 */
4045 {
4046 const size_t TOP = 8;
4047 size_t s0i, s1i;
4048 size_t t0i, t1i;
4049 secp256k1_ge ptg;
4050 secp256k1_gej ptgj;
4051
4052 random_group_element_test(&ptg);
4053 secp256k1_gej_set_ge(&ptgj, &ptg);
4054
4055 for(t0i = 0; t0i < TOP; t0i++) {
4056 for(t1i = 0; t1i < TOP; t1i++) {
4057 secp256k1_gej t0p, t1p;
4058 secp256k1_scalar t0, t1;
4059
4060 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&t0, (t0i + 1) / 2);
4061 secp256k1_scalar_cond_negate(&t0, t0i & 1);
4062 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&t1, (t1i + 1) / 2);
4063 secp256k1_scalar_cond_negate(&t1, t1i & 1);
4064
4065 secp256k1_ecmult(&t0p, &ptgj, &t0, &szero);
4066 secp256k1_ecmult(&t1p, &ptgj, &t1, &szero);
4067
4068 for(s0i = 0; s0i < TOP; s0i++) {
4069 for(s1i = 0; s1i < TOP; s1i++) {
4070 secp256k1_scalar tmp1, tmp2;
4071 secp256k1_gej expected, actual;
4072
4073 secp256k1_ge_set_gej(&pt[0], &t0p);
4074 secp256k1_ge_set_gej(&pt[1], &t1p);
4075
4076 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&sc[0], (s0i + 1) / 2);
4077 secp256k1_scalar_cond_negate(&sc[0], s0i & 1);
4078 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&sc[1], (s1i + 1) / 2);
4079 secp256k1_scalar_cond_negate(&sc[1], s1i & 1);
4080
4081 secp256k1_scalar_mul(&tmp1, &t0, &sc[0]);
4082 secp256k1_scalar_mul(&tmp2, &t1, &sc[1]);
4083 secp256k1_scalar_add(&tmp1, &tmp1, &tmp2);
4084
4085 secp256k1_ecmult(&expected, &ptgj, &tmp1, &szero);
4086 CHECK(ecmult_multi(&ctx->error_callback, scratch, &actual, &szero, ecmult_multi_callback, &data, 2));
4087 secp256k1_gej_neg(&expected, &expected);
4088 secp256k1_gej_add_var(&actual, &actual, &expected, NULL);
4089 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&actual));
4090 }
4091 }
4092 }
4093 }
4094 }
4095}

Run secp256k1_ecmult_multi_var with num points and a scratch space restricted to 1 <= i <= num points.

4388 secp256k1_scalar scG;
4389 secp256k1_scalar szero;

4419 * ecmult_mult_simple algorithm which doesn't require a scratch space. */

4427 * ecmult_multi selects strauss which requires more memory. It should
4428 * therefore select the simple algorithm. */

4432 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&r));
4433 secp256k1_scratch_destroy(&ctx->error_callback, scratch);
4434

4436 if (i > ECMULT_PIPPENGER_THRESHOLD) {
4437 int bucket_window = secp256k1_pippenger_bucket_window(i);
4438 size_t scratch_size = secp256k1_pippenger_scratch_size(i, bucket_window);

◆ test_ecmult_multi_pippenger_max_points()

void test_ecmult_multi_pippenger_max_points ( void  )

Probabilistically test the function returning the maximum number of possible points for a given scratch space.

Definition at line 4305 of file tests.c.

4305 {
4306 size_t scratch_size = secp256k1_testrand_bits(8);
4307 size_t max_size = secp256k1_pippenger_scratch_size(secp256k1_pippenger_bucket_window_inv(PIPPENGER_MAX_BUCKET_WINDOW-1)+512, 12);
4308 secp256k1_scratch *scratch;
4309 size_t n_points_supported;
4310 int bucket_window = 0;
4311
4312 for(; scratch_size < max_size; scratch_size+=256) {
4313 size_t i;
4314 size_t total_alloc;
4315 size_t checkpoint;
4316 scratch = secp256k1_scratch_create(&ctx->error_callback, scratch_size);
4317 CHECK(scratch != NULL);
4318 checkpoint = secp256k1_scratch_checkpoint(&ctx->error_callback, scratch);
4319 n_points_supported = secp256k1_pippenger_max_points(&ctx->error_callback, scratch);
4320 if (n_points_supported == 0) {
4321 secp256k1_scratch_destroy(&ctx->error_callback, scratch);
4322 continue;
4323 }
4324 bucket_window = secp256k1_pippenger_bucket_window(n_points_supported);
4325 /* allocate `total_alloc` bytes over `PIPPENGER_SCRATCH_OBJECTS` many allocations */
4326 total_alloc = secp256k1_pippenger_scratch_size(n_points_supported, bucket_window);
4327 for (i = 0; i < PIPPENGER_SCRATCH_OBJECTS - 1; i++) {
4328 CHECK(secp256k1_scratch_alloc(&ctx->error_callback, scratch, 1));
4329 total_alloc--;
4330 }
4331 CHECK(secp256k1_scratch_alloc(&ctx->error_callback, scratch, total_alloc));
4332 secp256k1_scratch_apply_checkpoint(&ctx->error_callback, scratch, checkpoint);
4333 secp256k1_scratch_destroy(&ctx->error_callback, scratch);
4334 }
4335 CHECK(bucket_window == PIPPENGER_MAX_BUCKET_WINDOW);
4336}

◆ test_ecmult_multi_random()

int test_ecmult_multi_random ( secp256k1_scratch *  scratch)

Definition at line 4097 of file tests.c.

4097 {
4098 /* Large random test for ecmult_multi_* functions which exercises:
4099 * - Few or many inputs (0 up to 128, roughly exponentially distributed).
4100 * - Few or many 0*P or a*INF inputs (roughly uniformly distributed).
4101 * - Including or excluding an nonzero a*G term (or such a term at all).
4102 * - Final expected result equal to infinity or not (roughly 50%).
4103 * - ecmult_multi_var, ecmult_strauss_single_batch, ecmult_pippenger_single_batch
4104 */
4105
4106 /* These 4 variables define the eventual input to the ecmult_multi function.
4107 * g_scalar is the G scalar fed to it (or NULL, possibly, if g_scalar=0), and
4108 * scalars[0..filled-1] and gejs[0..filled-1] are the scalars and points
4109 * which form its normal inputs. */
4110 int filled = 0;
4111 secp256k1_scalar g_scalar = SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
4112 secp256k1_scalar scalars[128];
4113 secp256k1_gej gejs[128];
4114 /* The expected result, and the computed result. */
4115 secp256k1_gej expected, computed;
4116 /* Temporaries. */
4117 secp256k1_scalar sc_tmp;
4118 secp256k1_ge ge_tmp;
4119 /* Variables needed for the actual input to ecmult_multi. */
4120 secp256k1_ge ges[128];
4121 ecmult_multi_data data;
4122
4123 int i;
4124 /* Which multiplication function to use */
4125 int fn = secp256k1_testrand_int(3);
4126 secp256k1_ecmult_multi_func ecmult_multi = fn == 0 ? secp256k1_ecmult_multi_var :
4127 fn == 1 ? secp256k1_ecmult_strauss_batch_single :
4128 secp256k1_ecmult_pippenger_batch_single;
4129 /* Simulate exponentially distributed num. */
4130 int num_bits = 2 + secp256k1_testrand_int(6);
4131 /* Number of (scalar, point) inputs (excluding g). */
4132 int num = secp256k1_testrand_int((1 << num_bits) + 1);
4133 /* Number of those which are nonzero. */
4134 int num_nonzero = secp256k1_testrand_int(num + 1);
4135 /* Whether we're aiming to create an input with nonzero expected result. */
4136 int nonzero_result = secp256k1_testrand_bits(1);
4137 /* Whether we will provide nonzero g multiplicand. In some cases our hand
4138 * is forced here based on num_nonzero and nonzero_result. */
4139 int g_nonzero = num_nonzero == 0 ? nonzero_result :
4140 num_nonzero == 1 && !nonzero_result ? 1 :
4141 (int)secp256k1_testrand_bits(1);
4142 /* Which g_scalar pointer to pass into ecmult_multi(). */
4143 const secp256k1_scalar* g_scalar_ptr = (g_nonzero || secp256k1_testrand_bits(1)) ? &g_scalar : NULL;
4144 /* How many EC multiplications were performed in this function. */
4145 int mults = 0;
4146 /* How many randomization steps to apply to the input list. */
4147 int rands = (int)secp256k1_testrand_bits(3);
4148 if (rands > num_nonzero) rands = num_nonzero;
4149
4150 secp256k1_gej_set_infinity(&expected);
4151 secp256k1_gej_set_infinity(&gejs[0]);
4152 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&scalars[0], 0);
4153
4154 if (g_nonzero) {
4155 /* If g_nonzero, set g_scalar to nonzero value r. */
4156 random_scalar_order_test(&g_scalar);
4157 if (!nonzero_result) {
4158 /* If expected=0 is desired, add a (a*r, -(1/a)*g) term to compensate. */
4159 CHECK(num_nonzero > filled);
4160 random_scalar_order_test(&sc_tmp);
4161 secp256k1_scalar_mul(&scalars[filled], &sc_tmp, &g_scalar);
4162 secp256k1_scalar_inverse_var(&sc_tmp, &sc_tmp);
4163 secp256k1_scalar_negate(&sc_tmp, &sc_tmp);
4164 secp256k1_ecmult_gen(&ctx->ecmult_gen_ctx, &gejs[filled], &sc_tmp);
4165 ++filled;
4166 ++mults;
4167 }
4168 }
4169
4170 if (nonzero_result && filled < num_nonzero) {
4171 /* If a nonzero result is desired, and there is space, add a random nonzero term. */
4172 random_scalar_order_test(&scalars[filled]);
4173 random_group_element_test(&ge_tmp);
4174 secp256k1_gej_set_ge(&gejs[filled], &ge_tmp);
4175 ++filled;
4176 }
4177
4178 if (nonzero_result) {
4179 /* Compute the expected result using normal ecmult. */
4180 CHECK(filled <= 1);
4181 secp256k1_ecmult(&expected, &gejs[0], &scalars[0], &g_scalar);
4182 mults += filled + g_nonzero;
4183 }
4184
4185 /* At this point we have expected = scalar_g*G + sum(scalars[i]*gejs[i] for i=0..filled-1). */
4186 CHECK(filled <= 1 + !nonzero_result);
4187 CHECK(filled <= num_nonzero);
4188
4189 /* Add entries to scalars,gejs so that there are num of them. All the added entries
4190 * either have scalar=0 or point=infinity, so these do not change the expected result. */
4191 while (filled < num) {
4192 if (secp256k1_testrand_bits(1)) {
4193 secp256k1_gej_set_infinity(&gejs[filled]);
4194 random_scalar_order_test(&scalars[filled]);
4195 } else {
4196 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&scalars[filled], 0);
4197 random_group_element_test(&ge_tmp);
4198 secp256k1_gej_set_ge(&gejs[filled], &ge_tmp);
4199 }
4200 ++filled;
4201 }
4202
4203 /* Now perform cheapish transformations on gejs and scalars, for indices
4204 * 0..num_nonzero-1, which do not change the expected result, but may
4205 * convert some of them to be both non-0-scalar and non-infinity-point. */
4206 for (i = 0; i < rands; ++i) {
4207 int j;
4208 secp256k1_scalar v, iv;
4209 /* Shuffle the entries. */
4210 for (j = 0; j < num_nonzero; ++j) {
4211 int k = secp256k1_testrand_int(num_nonzero - j);
4212 if (k != 0) {
4213 secp256k1_gej gej = gejs[j];
4214 secp256k1_scalar sc = scalars[j];
4215 gejs[j] = gejs[j + k];
4216 scalars[j] = scalars[j + k];
4217 gejs[j + k] = gej;
4218 scalars[j + k] = sc;
4219 }
4220 }
4221 /* Perturb all consecutive pairs of inputs:
4222 * a*P + b*Q -> (a+b)*P + b*(Q-P). */
4223 for (j = 0; j + 1 < num_nonzero; j += 2) {
4224 secp256k1_gej gej;
4225 secp256k1_scalar_add(&scalars[j], &scalars[j], &scalars[j+1]);
4226 secp256k1_gej_neg(&gej, &gejs[j]);
4227 secp256k1_gej_add_var(&gejs[j+1], &gejs[j+1], &gej, NULL);
4228 }
4229 /* Transform the last input: a*P -> (v*a) * ((1/v)*P). */
4230 CHECK(num_nonzero >= 1);
4231 random_scalar_order_test(&v);
4232 secp256k1_scalar_inverse(&iv, &v);
4233 secp256k1_scalar_mul(&scalars[num_nonzero - 1], &scalars[num_nonzero - 1], &v);
4234 secp256k1_ecmult(&gejs[num_nonzero - 1], &gejs[num_nonzero - 1], &iv, NULL);
4235 ++mults;
4236 }
4237
4238 /* Shuffle all entries (0..num-1). */
4239 for (i = 0; i < num; ++i) {
4240 int j = secp256k1_testrand_int(num - i);
4241 if (j != 0) {
4242 secp256k1_gej gej = gejs[i];
4243 secp256k1_scalar sc = scalars[i];
4244 gejs[i] = gejs[i + j];
4245 scalars[i] = scalars[i + j];
4246 gejs[i + j] = gej;
4247 scalars[i + j] = sc;
4248 }
4249 }
4250
4251 /* Compute affine versions of all inputs. */
4252 secp256k1_ge_set_all_gej_var(ges, gejs, filled);
4253 /* Invoke ecmult_multi code. */
4254 data.sc = scalars;
4255 data.pt = ges;
4256 CHECK(ecmult_multi(&ctx->error_callback, scratch, &computed, g_scalar_ptr, ecmult_multi_callback, &data, filled));
4257 mults += num_nonzero + g_nonzero;
4258 /* Compare with expected result. */
4259 secp256k1_gej_neg(&computed, &computed);
4260 secp256k1_gej_add_var(&computed, &computed, &expected, NULL);
4261 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&computed));
4262 return mults;
4263}
secp256k1_ecmult_multi_func
int(* secp256k1_ecmult_multi_func)(const secp256k1_callback *error_callback, secp256k1_scratch *, secp256k1_gej *, const secp256k1_scalar *, secp256k1_ecmult_multi_callback cb, void *, size_t)
Definition: ecmult_impl.h:810
secp256k1_ge_set_all_gej_var
static void secp256k1_ge_set_all_gej_var(secp256k1_ge *r, const secp256k1_gej *a, size_t len)

References CHECK, ctx, secp256k1_context_struct::ecmult_gen_ctx, ecmult_multi_callback(), secp256k1_context_struct::error_callback, ecmult_multi_data::pt, random_group_element_test(), random_scalar_order_test(), ecmult_multi_data::sc, secp256k1_ecmult(), secp256k1_ecmult_gen(), secp256k1_ecmult_multi_var(), secp256k1_ecmult_pippenger_batch_single(), secp256k1_ecmult_strauss_batch_single(), secp256k1_ge_set_all_gej_var(), secp256k1_gej_add_var(), secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(), secp256k1_gej_neg(), secp256k1_gej_set_ge(), secp256k1_gej_set_infinity(), secp256k1_scalar_add(), SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST, secp256k1_scalar_inverse(), secp256k1_scalar_inverse_var(), secp256k1_scalar_mul(), secp256k1_scalar_negate(), secp256k1_scalar_set_int(), secp256k1_testrand_bits(), and secp256k1_testrand_int().

3663 {
3664 /* Mode: 0=ecmult_gen, 1=ecmult, 2=ecmult_const */
3665 secp256k1_scalar n1, n2;
3666 secp256k1_ge p;
3667 secp256k1_gej pj, p1j, p2j, ptj;
3668 static const secp256k1_scalar zero = SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
3669
3670 /* Generate random n1,n2 such that n1+n2 = -target. */
3671 random_scalar_order_test(&n1);
3672 secp256k1_scalar_add(&n2, &n1, target);
3673 secp256k1_scalar_negate(&n2, &n2);
3674
3675 /* Generate a random input point. */
3676 if (mode != 0) {
3677 random_group_element_test(&p);
3678 secp256k1_gej_set_ge(&pj, &p);
3679 }
3680
3681 /* EC multiplications */

3683 secp256k1_ecmult_gen(&ctx->ecmult_gen_ctx, &p1j, &n1);
3684 secp256k1_ecmult_gen(&ctx->ecmult_gen_ctx, &p2j, &n2);
3685 secp256k1_ecmult_gen(&ctx->ecmult_gen_ctx, &ptj, target);
3686 } else if (mode == 1) {

3688 secp256k1_ecmult(&p2j, &pj, &n2, &zero);
3689 secp256k1_ecmult(&ptj, &pj, target, &zero);
3690 } else {
3691 secp256k1_ecmult_const(&p1j, &p, &n1, 256);
3692 secp256k1_ecmult_const(&p2j, &p, &n2, 256);
3693 secp256k1_ecmult_const(&ptj, &p, target, 256);
3694 }
3695
3696 /* Add them all up: n1*P + n2*P + target*P = (n1+n2+target)*P = (n1+n1-n1-n2)*P = 0. */
3697 secp256k1_gej_add_var(&ptj, &ptj, &p1j, NULL);
3698 secp256k1_gej_add_var(&ptj, &ptj, &p2j, NULL);
3699 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&ptj));
3700}

2555{
2556 secp256k1_fe c, an, bn;
2557 /* Variables in BE 32-byte format. */
2558 unsigned char a32[32], b32[32], c32[32];
2559 /* Variables in LE 16x uint16_t format. */
2560 uint16_t a16[16], b16[16], c16[16];
2561 /* Field modulus in LE 16x uint16_t format. */
2562 static const uint16_t m16[16] = {
2563 0xfc2f, 0xffff, 0xfffe, 0xffff, 0xffff, 0xffff, 0xffff, 0xffff,
2564 0xffff, 0xffff, 0xffff, 0xffff, 0xffff, 0xffff, 0xffff, 0xffff,
2565 };
2566 uint16_t t16[32];
2567 int i;
2568
2569 /* Compute C = A * B in fe format. */
2570 c = *a;
2571 if (use_sqr) {
2572 secp256k1_fe_sqr(&c, &c);
2573 } else {
2574 secp256k1_fe_mul(&c, &c, b);
2575 }
2576
2577 /* Convert A, B, C into LE 16x uint16_t format. */
2578 an = *a;
2579 bn = *b;
2580 secp256k1_fe_normalize_var(&c);
2581 secp256k1_fe_normalize_var(&an);
2582 secp256k1_fe_normalize_var(&bn);

2584 secp256k1_fe_get_b32(b32, &bn);
2585 secp256k1_fe_get_b32(c32, &c);
2586 for (i = 0; i < 16; ++i) {
2587 a16[i] = a32[31 - 2*i] + ((uint16_t)a32[30 - 2*i] << 8);
2588 b16[i] = b32[31 - 2*i] + ((uint16_t)b32[30 - 2*i] << 8);
2589 c16[i] = c32[31 - 2*i] + ((uint16_t)c32[30 - 2*i] << 8);
2590 }
2591 /* Compute T = A * B in LE 16x uint16_t format. */
2592 mulmod256(t16, a16, b16, m16);
2593 /* Compare */
2594 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(t16, c16, 32) == 0);
2595}

4598 }

◆ test_ge()

void test_ge ( void  )

Definition at line 3044 of file tests.c.

3044 {
3045 int i, i1;
3046 int runs = 6;
3047 /* 25 points are used:
3048 * - infinity
3049 * - for each of four random points p1 p2 p3 p4, we add the point, its
3050 * negation, and then those two again but with randomized Z coordinate.
3051 * - The same is then done for lambda*p1 and lambda^2*p1.
3052 */
3053 secp256k1_ge *ge = (secp256k1_ge *)checked_malloc(&ctx->error_callback, sizeof(secp256k1_ge) * (1 + 4 * runs));
3054 secp256k1_gej *gej = (secp256k1_gej *)checked_malloc(&ctx->error_callback, sizeof(secp256k1_gej) * (1 + 4 * runs));
3055 secp256k1_fe zf;
3056 secp256k1_fe zfi2, zfi3;
3057
3058 secp256k1_gej_set_infinity(&gej[0]);
3059 secp256k1_ge_clear(&ge[0]);
3060 secp256k1_ge_set_gej_var(&ge[0], &gej[0]);
3061 for (i = 0; i < runs; i++) {
3062 int j;
3063 secp256k1_ge g;
3064 random_group_element_test(&g);
3065 if (i >= runs - 2) {
3066 secp256k1_ge_mul_lambda(&g, &ge[1]);
3067 }
3068 if (i >= runs - 1) {
3069 secp256k1_ge_mul_lambda(&g, &g);
3070 }
3071 ge[1 + 4 * i] = g;
3072 ge[2 + 4 * i] = g;
3073 secp256k1_ge_neg(&ge[3 + 4 * i], &g);
3074 secp256k1_ge_neg(&ge[4 + 4 * i], &g);
3075 secp256k1_gej_set_ge(&gej[1 + 4 * i], &ge[1 + 4 * i]);
3076 random_group_element_jacobian_test(&gej[2 + 4 * i], &ge[2 + 4 * i]);
3077 secp256k1_gej_set_ge(&gej[3 + 4 * i], &ge[3 + 4 * i]);
3078 random_group_element_jacobian_test(&gej[4 + 4 * i], &ge[4 + 4 * i]);
3079 for (j = 0; j < 4; j++) {
3080 random_field_element_magnitude(&ge[1 + j + 4 * i].x);
3081 random_field_element_magnitude(&ge[1 + j + 4 * i].y);
3082 random_field_element_magnitude(&gej[1 + j + 4 * i].x);
3083 random_field_element_magnitude(&gej[1 + j + 4 * i].y);
3084 random_field_element_magnitude(&gej[1 + j + 4 * i].z);
3085 }
3086 }
3087
3088 /* Generate random zf, and zfi2 = 1/zf^2, zfi3 = 1/zf^3 */
3089 do {
3090 random_field_element_test(&zf);
3091 } while(secp256k1_fe_is_zero(&zf));
3092 random_field_element_magnitude(&zf);
3093 secp256k1_fe_inv_var(&zfi3, &zf);
3094 secp256k1_fe_sqr(&zfi2, &zfi3);
3095 secp256k1_fe_mul(&zfi3, &zfi3, &zfi2);
3096
3097 for (i1 = 0; i1 < 1 + 4 * runs; i1++) {
3098 int i2;
3099 for (i2 = 0; i2 < 1 + 4 * runs; i2++) {
3100 /* Compute reference result using gej + gej (var). */
3101 secp256k1_gej refj, resj;
3102 secp256k1_ge ref;
3103 secp256k1_fe zr;
3104 secp256k1_gej_add_var(&refj, &gej[i1], &gej[i2], secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&gej[i1]) ? NULL : &zr);
3105 /* Check Z ratio. */
3106 if (!secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&gej[i1]) && !secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&refj)) {
3107 secp256k1_fe zrz; secp256k1_fe_mul(&zrz, &zr, &gej[i1].z);
3108 CHECK(secp256k1_fe_equal_var(&zrz, &refj.z));
3109 }
3110 secp256k1_ge_set_gej_var(&ref, &refj);
3111
3112 /* Test gej + ge with Z ratio result (var). */
3113 secp256k1_gej_add_ge_var(&resj, &gej[i1], &ge[i2], secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&gej[i1]) ? NULL : &zr);
3114 ge_equals_gej(&ref, &resj);
3115 if (!secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&gej[i1]) && !secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&resj)) {
3116 secp256k1_fe zrz; secp256k1_fe_mul(&zrz, &zr, &gej[i1].z);
3117 CHECK(secp256k1_fe_equal_var(&zrz, &resj.z));
3118 }
3119
3120 /* Test gej + ge (var, with additional Z factor). */
3121 {
3122 secp256k1_ge ge2_zfi = ge[i2]; /* the second term with x and y rescaled for z = 1/zf */
3123 secp256k1_fe_mul(&ge2_zfi.x, &ge2_zfi.x, &zfi2);
3124 secp256k1_fe_mul(&ge2_zfi.y, &ge2_zfi.y, &zfi3);
3125 random_field_element_magnitude(&ge2_zfi.x);
3126 random_field_element_magnitude(&ge2_zfi.y);
3127 secp256k1_gej_add_zinv_var(&resj, &gej[i1], &ge2_zfi, &zf);
3128 ge_equals_gej(&ref, &resj);
3129 }
3130
3131 /* Test gej + ge (const). */
3132 if (i2 != 0) {
3133 /* secp256k1_gej_add_ge does not support its second argument being infinity. */
3134 secp256k1_gej_add_ge(&resj, &gej[i1], &ge[i2]);
3135 ge_equals_gej(&ref, &resj);
3136 }
3137
3138 /* Test doubling (var). */
3139 if ((i1 == 0 && i2 == 0) || ((i1 + 3)/4 == (i2 + 3)/4 && ((i1 + 3)%4)/2 == ((i2 + 3)%4)/2)) {
3140 secp256k1_fe zr2;
3141 /* Normal doubling with Z ratio result. */
3142 secp256k1_gej_double_var(&resj, &gej[i1], &zr2);
3143 ge_equals_gej(&ref, &resj);
3144 /* Check Z ratio. */
3145 secp256k1_fe_mul(&zr2, &zr2, &gej[i1].z);
3146 CHECK(secp256k1_fe_equal_var(&zr2, &resj.z));
3147 /* Normal doubling. */
3148 secp256k1_gej_double_var(&resj, &gej[i2], NULL);
3149 ge_equals_gej(&ref, &resj);
3150 /* Constant-time doubling. */
3151 secp256k1_gej_double(&resj, &gej[i2]);
3152 ge_equals_gej(&ref, &resj);
3153 }
3154
3155 /* Test adding opposites. */
3156 if ((i1 == 0 && i2 == 0) || ((i1 + 3)/4 == (i2 + 3)/4 && ((i1 + 3)%4)/2 != ((i2 + 3)%4)/2)) {
3157 CHECK(secp256k1_ge_is_infinity(&ref));
3158 }
3159
3160 /* Test adding infinity. */
3161 if (i1 == 0) {
3162 CHECK(secp256k1_ge_is_infinity(&ge[i1]));
3163 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&gej[i1]));
3164 ge_equals_gej(&ref, &gej[i2]);
3165 }
3166 if (i2 == 0) {
3167 CHECK(secp256k1_ge_is_infinity(&ge[i2]));
3168 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&gej[i2]));
3169 ge_equals_gej(&ref, &gej[i1]);
3170 }
3171 }
3172 }
3173
3174 /* Test adding all points together in random order equals infinity. */
3175 {
3176 secp256k1_gej sum = SECP256K1_GEJ_CONST_INFINITY;
3177 secp256k1_gej *gej_shuffled = (secp256k1_gej *)checked_malloc(&ctx->error_callback, (4 * runs + 1) * sizeof(secp256k1_gej));
3178 for (i = 0; i < 4 * runs + 1; i++) {
3179 gej_shuffled[i] = gej[i];
3180 }
3181 for (i = 0; i < 4 * runs + 1; i++) {
3182 int swap = i + secp256k1_testrand_int(4 * runs + 1 - i);
3183 if (swap != i) {
3184 secp256k1_gej t = gej_shuffled[i];
3185 gej_shuffled[i] = gej_shuffled[swap];
3186 gej_shuffled[swap] = t;
3187 }
3188 }
3189 for (i = 0; i < 4 * runs + 1; i++) {
3190 secp256k1_gej_add_var(&sum, &sum, &gej_shuffled[i], NULL);
3191 }
3192 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&sum));
3193 free(gej_shuffled);
3194 }
3195
3196 /* Test batch gej -> ge conversion without known z ratios. */
3197 {
3198 secp256k1_ge *ge_set_all = (secp256k1_ge *)checked_malloc(&ctx->error_callback, (4 * runs + 1) * sizeof(secp256k1_ge));
3199 secp256k1_ge_set_all_gej_var(ge_set_all, gej, 4 * runs + 1);
3200 for (i = 0; i < 4 * runs + 1; i++) {
3201 secp256k1_fe s;
3202 random_fe_non_zero(&s);
3203 secp256k1_gej_rescale(&gej[i], &s);
3204 ge_equals_gej(&ge_set_all[i], &gej[i]);
3205 }
3206 free(ge_set_all);
3207 }
3208
3209 /* Test batch gej -> ge conversion with many infinities. */
3210 for (i = 0; i < 4 * runs + 1; i++) {
3211 int odd;
3212 random_group_element_test(&ge[i]);
3213 odd = secp256k1_fe_is_odd(&ge[i].x);
3214 CHECK(odd == 0 || odd == 1);
3215 /* randomly set half the points to infinity */
3216 if (odd == i % 2) {
3217 secp256k1_ge_set_infinity(&ge[i]);
3218 }
3219 secp256k1_gej_set_ge(&gej[i], &ge[i]);
3220 }
3221 /* batch convert */
3222 secp256k1_ge_set_all_gej_var(ge, gej, 4 * runs + 1);
3223 /* check result */
3224 for (i = 0; i < 4 * runs + 1; i++) {
3225 ge_equals_gej(&ge[i], &gej[i]);
3226 }
3227
3228 /* Test batch gej -> ge conversion with all infinities. */
3229 for (i = 0; i < 4 * runs + 1; i++) {
3230 secp256k1_gej_set_infinity(&gej[i]);
3231 }
3232 /* batch convert */
3233 secp256k1_ge_set_all_gej_var(ge, gej, 4 * runs + 1);
3234 /* check result */
3235 for (i = 0; i < 4 * runs + 1; i++) {
3236 CHECK(secp256k1_ge_is_infinity(&ge[i]));
3237 }
3238
3239 free(ge);
3240 free(gej);
3241}

2725 secp256k1_fe l, r, t;
2726
2727 (var ? secp256k1_fe_inv_var : secp256k1_fe_inv)(&l, x) ; /* l = 1/x */
2728 if (out) *out = l;
2729 t = *x; /* t = x */
2730 if (secp256k1_fe_normalizes_to_zero_var(&t)) {
2731 CHECK(secp256k1_fe_normalizes_to_zero(&l));
2732 return;
2733 }
2734 secp256k1_fe_mul(&t, x, &l); /* t = x*(1/x) */
2735 secp256k1_fe_add(&t, &fe_minus_one); /* t = x*(1/x)-1 */
2736 CHECK(secp256k1_fe_normalizes_to_zero(&t)); /* x*(1/x)-1 == 0 */
2737 r = *x; /* r = x */
2738 secp256k1_fe_add(&r, &fe_minus_one); /* r = x-1 */
2739 if (secp256k1_fe_normalizes_to_zero_var(&r)) return;
2740 (var ? secp256k1_fe_inv_var : secp256k1_fe_inv)(&r, &r); /* r = 1/(x-1) */
2741 secp256k1_fe_add(&l, &fe_minus_one); /* l = 1/x-1 */
2742 (var ? secp256k1_fe_inv_var : secp256k1_fe_inv)(&l, &l); /* l = 1/(1/x-1) */
2743 secp256k1_fe_add(&l, &secp256k1_fe_one); /* l = 1/(1/x-1)+1 */
2744 secp256k1_fe_add(&l, &r); /* l = 1/(1/x-1)+1 + 1/(x-1) */
2745 CHECK(secp256k1_fe_normalizes_to_zero_var(&l)); /* l == 0 */
2746}

813 {
814 uint16_t tmp[16];

816 secp256k1_modinv32_modinfo m;
817 int i, vartime, nonzero;
818
819 uint16_to_signed30(&x, in);
820 nonzero = (x.v[0] | x.v[1] | x.v[2] | x.v[3] | x.v[4] | x.v[5] | x.v[6] | x.v[7] | x.v[8]) != 0;
821 uint16_to_signed30(&m.modulus, mod);
822 mutate_sign_signed30(&m.modulus);
823
824 /* compute 1/modulus mod 2^30 */
825 m.modulus_inv30 = modinv2p64(m.modulus.v[0]) & 0x3fffffff;
826 CHECK(((m.modulus_inv30 * m.modulus.v[0]) & 0x3fffffff) == 1);
827
828 for (vartime = 0; vartime < 2; ++vartime) {
829 /* compute inverse */
830 (vartime ? secp256k1_modinv32_var : secp256k1_modinv32)(&x, &m);
831
832 /* produce output */
833 signed30_to_uint16(out, &x);
834
835 /* check if the inverse times the input is 1 (mod m), unless x is 0. */
836 mulmod256(tmp, out, in, mod);
837 CHECK(tmp[0] == nonzero);
838 for (i = 1; i < 16; ++i) CHECK(tmp[i] == 0);
839
840 /* invert again */
841 (vartime ? secp256k1_modinv32_var : secp256k1_modinv32)(&x, &m);
842
843 /* check if the result is equal to the input */
844 signed30_to_uint16(tmp, &x);
845 for (i = 0; i < 16; ++i) CHECK(tmp[i] == in[i]);

◆ test_point_times_order()

void test_point_times_order ( const secp256k1_gej *  point)

3599 {
3600 /* X * (point + G) + (order-X) * (pointer + G) = 0 */
3601 secp256k1_scalar x;
3602 secp256k1_scalar nx;
3603 secp256k1_scalar zero = SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
3604 secp256k1_scalar one = SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1);

3606 secp256k1_ge res3;
3607 unsigned char pub[65];
3608 size_t psize = 65;
3609 random_scalar_order_test(&x);
3610 secp256k1_scalar_negate(&nx, &x);
3611 secp256k1_ecmult(&res1, point, &x, &x); /* calc res1 = x * point + x * G; */
3612 secp256k1_ecmult(&res2, point, &nx, &nx); /* calc res2 = (order - x) * point + (order - x) * G; */

3614 CHECK(secp256k1_gej_is_infinity(&res1));

3616 CHECK(secp256k1_ge_is_infinity(&res3));
3617 CHECK(secp256k1_ge_is_valid_var(&res3) == 0);
3618 CHECK(secp256k1_eckey_pubkey_serialize(&res3, pub, &psize, 0) == 0);
3619 psize = 65;
3620 CHECK(secp256k1_eckey_pubkey_serialize(&res3, pub, &psize, 1) == 0);
3621 /* check zero/one edge cases */

3623 secp256k1_ge_set_gej(&res3, &res1);
3624 CHECK(secp256k1_ge_is_infinity(&res3));

◆ test_pre_g_table()

void test_pre_g_table ( const secp256k1_ge_storage *  pre_g,
size_t  n 
)

Definition at line 3461 of file tests.c.

3461 {
3462 /* Tests the pre_g / pre_g_128 tables for consistency.
3463 * For independent verification we take a "geometric" approach to verification.
3464 * We check that every entry is on-curve.
3465 * We check that for consecutive entries p and q, that p + gg - q = 0 by checking
3466 * (1) p, gg, and -q are colinear.
3467 * (2) p, gg, and -q are all distinct.
3468 * where gg is twice the generator, where the generator is the first table entry.
3469 *
3470 * Checking the table's generators are correct is done in run_ecmult_pre_g.
3471 */
3472 secp256k1_gej g2;
3473 secp256k1_ge p, q, gg;
3474 secp256k1_fe dpx, dpy, dqx, dqy;
3475 size_t i;
3476
3477 CHECK(0 < n);
3478
3479 secp256k1_ge_from_storage(&p, &pre_g[0]);
3480 CHECK(secp256k1_ge_is_valid_var(&p));
3481
3482 secp256k1_gej_set_ge(&g2, &p);
3483 secp256k1_gej_double_var(&g2, &g2, NULL);
3484 secp256k1_ge_set_gej_var(&gg, &g2);
3485 for (i = 1; i < n; ++i) {
3486 secp256k1_fe_negate(&dpx, &p.x, 1); secp256k1_fe_add(&dpx, &gg.x); secp256k1_fe_normalize_weak(&dpx);
3487 secp256k1_fe_negate(&dpy, &p.y, 1); secp256k1_fe_add(&dpy, &gg.y); secp256k1_fe_normalize_weak(&dpy);
3488 /* Check that p is not equal to gg */
3489 CHECK(!secp256k1_fe_normalizes_to_zero_var(&dpx) || !secp256k1_fe_normalizes_to_zero_var(&dpy));
3490
3491 secp256k1_ge_from_storage(&q, &pre_g[i]);
3492 CHECK(secp256k1_ge_is_valid_var(&q));
3493
3494 secp256k1_fe_negate(&dqx, &q.x, 1); secp256k1_fe_add(&dqx, &gg.x); secp256k1_fe_normalize_weak(&dqx);
3495 dqy = q.y; secp256k1_fe_add(&dqy, &gg.y); secp256k1_fe_normalize_weak(&dqy);
3496 /* Check that -q is not equal to gg */
3497 CHECK(!secp256k1_fe_normalizes_to_zero_var(&dqx) || !secp256k1_fe_normalizes_to_zero_var(&dqy));
3498
3499 /* Check that -q is not equal to p */
3500 CHECK(!secp256k1_fe_equal_var(&dpx, &dqx) || !secp256k1_fe_equal_var(&dpy, &dqy));
3501
3502 /* Check that p, -q and gg are colinear */
3503 secp256k1_fe_mul(&dpx, &dpx, &dqy);
3504 secp256k1_fe_mul(&dpy, &dpy, &dqx);
3505 CHECK(secp256k1_fe_equal_var(&dpx, &dpy));
3506
3507 p = q;
3508 }
3509}
secp256k1_ge_from_storage
static void secp256k1_ge_from_storage(secp256k1_ge *r, const secp256k1_ge_storage *a)

◆ test_rand_bits()

void test_rand_bits ( int  rand32,
int  bits 
)

Definition at line 609 of file tests.c.

609 {
610 /* (1-1/2^B)^rounds[B] < 1/10^9, so rounds is the number of iterations to
611 * get a false negative chance below once in a billion */
612 static const unsigned int rounds[7] = {1, 30, 73, 156, 322, 653, 1316};
613 /* We try multiplying the results with various odd numbers, which shouldn't
614 * influence the uniform distribution modulo a power of 2. */
615 static const uint32_t mults[6] = {1, 3, 21, 289, 0x9999, 0x80402011};
616 /* We only select up to 6 bits from the output to analyse */
617 unsigned int usebits = bits > 6 ? 6 : bits;
618 unsigned int maxshift = bits - usebits;
619 /* For each of the maxshift+1 usebits-bit sequences inside a bits-bit
620 number, track all observed outcomes, one per bit in a uint64_t. */
621 uint64_t x[6][27] = {{0}};
622 unsigned int i, shift, m;
623 /* Multiply the output of all rand calls with the odd number m, which
624 should not change the uniformity of its distribution. */
625 for (i = 0; i < rounds[usebits]; i++) {
626 uint32_t r = (rand32 ? secp256k1_testrand32() : secp256k1_testrand_bits(bits));
627 CHECK((((uint64_t)r) >> bits) == 0);
628 for (m = 0; m < sizeof(mults) / sizeof(mults[0]); m++) {
629 uint32_t rm = r * mults[m];
630 for (shift = 0; shift <= maxshift; shift++) {
631 x[m][shift] |= (((uint64_t)1) << ((rm >> shift) & ((1 << usebits) - 1)));
632 }
633 }
634 }
635 for (m = 0; m < sizeof(mults) / sizeof(mults[0]); m++) {
636 for (shift = 0; shift <= maxshift; shift++) {
637 /* Test that the lower usebits bits of x[shift] are 1 */
638 CHECK(((~x[m][shift]) << (64 - (1 << usebits))) == 0);
639 }
640 }
641}
secp256k1_testrand32
static SECP256K1_INLINE uint32_t secp256k1_testrand32(void)

References CHECK, secp256k1_testrand32(), and secp256k1_testrand_bits().

Referenced by run_rand_bits().

◆ test_rand_int()

void test_rand_int ( uint32_t  range,
uint32_t  subrange 
)

Definition at line 644 of file tests.c.

644 {
645 /* (1-1/subrange)^rounds < 1/10^9 */
646 int rounds = (subrange * 2073) / 100;
647 int i;
648 uint64_t x = 0;
649 CHECK((range % subrange) == 0);
650 for (i = 0; i < rounds; i++) {
651 uint32_t r = secp256k1_testrand_int(range);
652 CHECK(r < range);
653 r = r % subrange;
654 x |= (((uint64_t)1) << r);
655 }
656 /* Test that the lower subrange bits of x are 1. */
657 CHECK(((~x) << (64 - subrange)) == 0);
658}

5909 len = secp256k1_testrand_bits(6);
5910 }
5911 if (len == 65) {
5912 in[0] = secp256k1_testrand_bits(1) ? 4 : (secp256k1_testrand_bits(1) ? 6 : 7);
5913 } else {
5914 in[0] = secp256k1_testrand_bits(1) ? 2 : 3;
5915 }
5916 if (secp256k1_testrand_bits(3) == 0) {
5917 in[0] = secp256k1_testrand_bits(8);
5918 }

5928 int res;

5930 firstb = in[0];

5933 CHECK(size == len);
5934 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&in[1], &out[1], len-1) == 0);
5935 /* ... except for the type of hybrid inputs. */

5937 CHECK(in[0] == out[0]);
5938 }

5941 CHECK(size == 65);
5942 CHECK(secp256k1_eckey_pubkey_parse(&elem2, in, size));

5944 /* Check that the X9.62 hybrid type is checked. */
5945 in[0] = secp256k1_testrand_bits(1) ? 6 : 7;
5946 res = secp256k1_eckey_pubkey_parse(&elem2, in, size);
5947 if (firstb == 2 || firstb == 3) {
5948 if (in[0] == firstb + 4) {
5949 CHECK(res);
5950 } else {
5951 CHECK(!res);
5952 }
5953 }
5954 if (res) {
5955 ge_equals_ge(&elem,&elem2);
5956 CHECK(secp256k1_eckey_pubkey_serialize(&elem, out, &size, 0));
5957 CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(&in[1], &out[1], 64) == 0);
5958 }
5959 }

4484 int i;

4486 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&x, 0);
4487 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&two, 2);
4488 bits = secp256k1_ecmult_wnaf(wnaf, 256, number, w);
4489 CHECK(bits <= 256);
4490 for (i = bits-1; i >= 0; i--) {
4491 int v = wnaf[i];
4492 secp256k1_scalar_mul(&x, &x, &two);
4493 if (v) {
4494 CHECK(zeroes == -1 || zeroes >= w-1); /* check that distance between non-zero elements is at least w-1 */
4495 zeroes=0;
4496 CHECK((v & 1) == 1); /* check non-zero elements are odd */
4497 CHECK(v <= (1 << (w-1)) - 1); /* check range below */
4498 CHECK(v >= -(1 << (w-1)) - 1); /* check range above */
4499 } else {
4500 CHECK(zeroes != -1); /* check that no unnecessary zero padding exists */
4501 zeroes++;
4502 }
4503 if (v >= 0) {
4504 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&t, v);
4505 } else {
4506 secp256k1_scalar_set_int(&t, -v);
4507 secp256k1_scalar_negate(&t, &t);
4508 }
4509 secp256k1_scalar_add(&x, &x, &t);
4510 }
4511 CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_eq(&x, number)); /* check that wnaf represents number */
4512}
